characters: GRISSOM, JOHN GLENN, SCOTT CARPENTER, WALLY SCHIRRA, GORD
SHOTS OF THE ENTIRE NATION COUNTING DOWN
JOHN GLENN ON THE PHONE AT THE CAPE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A pair of little feet navigates down a gravel path. Kicki a pine cone.

dialogues.speaker: LITTLE GIRL, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: 20, 21, 22, prime, 24, 25, 26... Pulling up, we reveal: KATHERINE COLEMAN (8,) a peculiar, quiet, mouse of a child, wearing glasses bigger than her bookish face. Counting to herself. A VOICE (her Mother’s) in the distance hollers out:

dialogues.speaker: JOYLETTE COLEMAN, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Katherine! Come on now! Katherine looks up. Sees a car stopped at the end of the path. She runs off. Counting all the way. Titles over: White Sulphur Springs, Virginia - 1926

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A “colored” grammar school. Small, spirited. Katherine’s now between her parents (dad: JOSHUA and JOYLETTE,) holdi their hands as they enter. INT. WHITE SULPHUR SPRINGS GRAMMAR SCHOOL - DAY - CONT. A long hallway lined with windows. Sitting on a bench, outside a Principal’s office, Katherine sketches (in a sm notebook) the window panes, highlighting all the geometri shapes she discovers within:

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE
dialogues.text: Isosceles, scalene, obtuse, equilateral, rhombus... On the windows opposite her: the tetris-like patterns of mind’s eye come alive. KATHERINE (@8 YEARS OLD) (CONT’D) Trapezoid, tetrahedron, octahedron, dodecahedron... And on she goes. Script provided for educational purposes. More scripts ca  Hidden Figures - 5/9/2016 - Shooting Draft - 2 . INT. PRINCIPAL’S OFFICE - CONTINUOUS Katherine's parents sit across from the school’s principa MR. MARION SMITHSON and Katherine’s teacher, MS. SUMNER.

dialogues.speaker: MARION SMITHSON
dialogues.text: West Virginia Collegiate Institute is the best school for Negros in the state.

dialogues.speaker: MS. SUMNER
dialogues.text: It’s the only school, past the eighth grade, anywhere close to here.

dialogues.speaker: JOSHUA COLEMAN
dialogues.text: Katherine’s in the sixth grade.

dialogues.speaker: MS. SUMNER
dialogues.text: They want to take her early.

dialogues.speaker: MARION SMITHSON
dialogues.text: They're offering a full scholarship. All you have to do is get there. Joshua and Joylette are overwhelmed. They grasp each othe hands.

dialogues.speaker: MS. SUMNER
dialogues.text: Joshua, Joylette...we took up a collection amongst the teachers and such, a few parents. Ms. Sumner hands Joylette an envelope. MS. SUMNER (CONT’D) It’s not a whole lot, but it’1l surely help get you settled in. Joylette accepts the envelope.

dialogues.speaker: JOYLETTE COLEMAN
dialogues.text: That’s beyond kind, Ms. Sumner.

dialogues.speaker: MS. SUMNER
dialogues.text: In all my years of teaching, I’ve never seen a mind like the one your daughter has. You have to go. You have to see what she becomes. Joylette starts to tear. The kindness of people. Joshua puts his arm around his wife. Script provided for educational purposes. More scripts ca  Hidden Figures - 5/9/2016 - Shooting Draft - 3 .

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Coleman family car, hauling a trailer with all their belongings, drives past a pasture dotted with COWS. A roa sign reads: Welcome to Institute, Virginia.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Katherine’s crowded in the back seat with her siblings (CHARLES, MARGARET and HORACE.) She stares out the window studying the cows whizzing by, the patterns on their hide forming shapes in her mind. She studies the shapes, only she’s...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...staring out another window in a new classroom. A fancy classroom in a prestigious academy. The class is full of OLDER STUDENTS dressed in the best they have. Unbeknownst to Katherine, her new teacher, PROFESSOR GRAV is standing right in front of her.

dialogues.speaker: PROFESSOR GRAVES
dialogues.text: Ms. Coleman. Katherine whips back to reality. Embarrassed. PROFESSOR GRAVES (CONT’D) You find something out there more interesting than quadratic equations?

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE
dialogues.text: Yes, sir. I mean no, sir. Professor Graves holds out a piece of chalk.

dialogues.speaker: PROFESSOR GRAVES
dialogues.text: Why don’t you figure out the equation on the board? Katherine looks at the chalkboard. The equation looks Gre symbols, signs, parentheticals. Professor Graves pushes the chalk closer.

dialogues.speaker: PROFESSOR GRAVES, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Go on. Katherine takes the chalk. Stands. Walks sheepishly to th front of the class. Every eye on her. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Script provided for educational purposes. More scripts ca  Hidden Figures - 5/9/2016 - Shooting Draft - 4 .

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: She stands in front of the blackboard, the equation. Stud it for the longest time. Inspecting every number, sign, symbol. Wheels churning. Then she starts to write. Slow and meticulous at first. Then fast. Faster. With passion and fury. The Students crane their heads. Professor Graves rubs his temple. And Katherine writes on, chalk dust dropping like snow fr her chalk stick. On and on and on...until she’s at the ve bottom, far side of the board. She circles the answer. Stands and faces the class. The equation behind her dwarf her in stature. She clears her throat...

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE
dialogues.text: If the product of two terms is zero, then common sense says at least one of the two terms has to be zero to start with. So, if you move all the terms over to one side, you can put the quadratics into a form that can be factored, allowing that side of the equation to equal zero. Once you've done that, it’s pretty straight forward from there... You can hear a pin drop. There’s nothing to say. Katherin shuffles. Adjusts her glasses. KATHERINE (@8 YEARS OLD) (CONT’D) -..Sir. Katherine walks back to her desk. We push in on the equation. The numbers. The endless, endless numbers. The title fades up: Hidden Figures

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We float down towards a lone stretch of road in the middl nowhere. Infinity in all directions. A 1955 Chevy Impala sits on the shoulder, the hood up.

dialogues.speaker: THE CAR
dialogues.text: KATHERINE GOBLE (now 38) sits in the passenger seat, star out the window. Up into space. Titles over: Hampton, Virginia, 1961

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Script provided for educational purposes. More scripts ca  Hidden Figures - 5/9/2016 - Shooting Draft - 5 .

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: A holler crashes the silence:

dialogues.speaker: DOROTHY, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Try and turn it over! Outside, a pair of legs poke out from under the car. DOROTHY (0.S.) (CONT’D) Katherine?! DOROTHY VAUGHAN (40s) slides out from under the car. No- nonsense, brilliant, tough, mechanically gifted.

dialogues.speaker: DOROTHY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Mary!? At the back of the car, sitting on the trunk, we find MAR JACKSON (30ish) putting on lipstick. Mary’s a spirited beauty, free-tongued, unbridled.

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: Katherine!? Quit staring off into space! Turn the damn car over! Mary bangs on the rear window. Katherine snaps out of her trance.

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE
dialogues.text: I got it. I’m not deaf.

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: I wonder some times. Katherine slides over to the driver’s seat. Pumps the gas Stamps the pedal to the floor.

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE
dialogues.text: Here it goes. She turns the key in the ignition. Click, click, click. T engine whines, the car doesn’t start.

dialogues.speaker: DOROTHY
dialogues.text: That's the starter. It’s definitely the starter.

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: That starter’s startin’ to make us late. We’re all gonna be unemployed driving this hunk of junk to work everyday.

dialogues.speaker: DOROTHY
dialogues.text: You’re welcome to walk the 16 miles. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Script provided for educational purposes. More scripts ca  Hidden Figures - 5/9/2016 - Shooting Draft - 6 .

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE
dialogues.text: Or sit on the back of the bus.

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: Won't do neither. I’11 hitchhike. Mary models her hitchhiking thumb, pose. Just then, far in the distance, Mary sees a POLICE CAR co over the hill...

dialogues.speaker: MARY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Girls. Dorothy and Katherine look. See the car coming up fast.

dialogues.speaker: DOROTHY
dialogues.text: No crime in a broken down car.

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: No crime being Negro either. Katherine gets out of the car. Dorothy stands up.

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE
dialogues.text: Button it up, Mary. No one wants to go to jail behind your mouth.

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: I’1ll do my best, sugar. The police car stops behind them. And the gruffest WHITE steps out. Walks toward them. Silent. Then...

dialogues.speaker: WHITE COP
dialogues.text: Not a great place for the three of ya’ll to be havin’ car trouble. Mary can’t help herself.

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: We didn’t pick the place, Officer. It picked us. The White Cop steps into Mary. Not interested in talk bac

dialogues.speaker: WHITE COP
dialogues.text: You bein’ disrespectful? Mary shakes her head.

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: No, sir. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Script provided for educational purposes. More scripts ca  Hidden Figures - 5/9/2016 - Shooting Draft - 7 .

dialogues.speaker: WHITE COP
dialogues.text: You have identification on ya? Katherine jumps in.

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE
dialogues.text: We sure do. We’re just on our way to work. At Langley. Katherine pulls out her NASA ID badge. Holds it up for hi to see.

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: NASA, sir. Dorothy specifies, holds up her NASA badge.

dialogues.speaker: DOROTHY
dialogues.text: We do a great deal of the calculating getting our rockets into space. He turns his attention back to Mary.

dialogues.speaker: WHITE COP
dialogues.text: All three of ya? Mary pulls out her NASA badge.

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: Yes, Officer. Hmm. He takes Mary’s badge. Studies it. Inspects the back It’s official.

dialogues.speaker: WHITE COP
dialogues.text: NASA. That’s somethin’. Had no idea they hired- He stops himself from saying “coloreds.” Or worse.

dialogues.speaker: DOROTHY
dialogues.text: There are quite a few women working in the Space Program, sir. She saves him the embarrassment. He looks toward the sky. Paranoid.

dialogues.speaker: WHITE COP
dialogues.text: Damn Russians are watching us right now. Sputniks. His wheels turn. Shifting gears. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Script provided for educational purposes. More scripts ca  Hidden Figures - 5/9/2016 - Shooting Draft - 8 .

dialogues.speaker: WHITE COP, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You girls ever meet those Astronauts? The Mercury 7? Mary lies through her teeth:

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: Absolutely.

dialogues.speaker: WHITE COP
dialogues.text: Alan Shepard? John Glenn?

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE
dialogues.text: We work with those gentlemen all the time. The White Cop gets patriotic.

dialogues.speaker: WHITE COP
dialogues.text: Those boys are the best we got. That’s for sure. We have-ta get a man up there before the Commies do. Whole damn country’s counting on ‘em.

dialogues.speaker: DOROTHY
dialogues.text: That’s for certain.

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: Hard to be of service broken down on the side of the road though. The White Cop springs into action.

dialogues.speaker: WHITE COP
dialogues.text: That's right. That’s right. You need a tow or somethin’? Dorothy motions to Katherine to toss the screwdriver to h She does.

dialogues.speaker: DOROTHY
dialogues.text: No, thank you, Officer. I think I got it, right here. Just have to bypass the starter... Dorothy ducks under the hood. Crosses the screwdriver acr the battery poles. SPARK! The engine starts. DOROTHY (CONT’D) That’a girl. We’re all set. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Script provided for educational purposes. More scripts ca  Hidden Figures - 5/9/2016 - Shooting Draft - 9 .

dialogues.speaker: WHITE COP
dialogues.text: Hell. Least I can do is give ya an escort. Imagine ya’ll are running late.

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE
dialogues.text: Oh, we wouldn’t want to trouble you. Mary butts in.

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: That would be wonderful, Officer. Damn Mary.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The police car screams down the road at a million miles a hour. Dorothy’s car lunges right on its tail. INT. DOROTHY’S CAR - DAY - CONTINUOUS Mary’s driving like a mad-woman. Loving every minute of i Dorothy’s in the passenger seat, white knuckling the dashboard. And Katherine’s in the back, holding onto the ceiling. Praying.

dialogues.speaker: DOROTHY
dialogues.text: Slow down, Mary! You’re too close!

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: He said to follow him.

dialogues.speaker: DOROTHY
dialogues.text: Doesn’t mean you hit him in the ass!

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE
dialogues.text: Dear Lord...please...I don’t even know where to begin!

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: I‘1l tell you where to begin: three “colored” women are chasing a white police officer down the highway in Hampton, Virginia, 1961. Ladies, that there is a God ordained miracle! Mary screams! Dorothy bursts out laughing. Finally... Katherine. Mary hits the gas. The car lunges forward. Script provided for educational purposes. More scripts ca  Hidden Figures - 5/9/2016 - Shooting Draft - 10 .

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sprawling campus of NASA: hangars, wind tunnels, rese buildings, surrounded by tall, barbed wire fences and SECURITY. The police car slows, pulls to the shoulder, as Dorothy’s speeds past. The White Cop waves them on. And our camera floats up to...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From the vast blackness of space...looking down on Planet Earth. Quiet. Picturesque. Peaceful. Then: a rumbling sound creeps up. And the camera pans to find...a massive ROCKET burning up through the earth’s atmosphere. Atop the rocket, a capsule shakes, rattles, grinds. The noise is deafening. We then hear a RUSSIAN VOICE, military-esque. The VOICE t translates into TURKISH...matter of fact. And finally: Th CRACKLING VOICE of a radio communication in English. Not happy at all. Tense.

dialogues.speaker: CRACKLING VOICE, (ON RADIO)
dialogues.text: Approximate speed: 17,400 mph. Ascend angle: 42.46. Closing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Oval Office. President Kennedy is handed a briefing d He’s worried. The VOICE OF AN AIDE: PRESIDENT’S AIDE (0.S.) Latest intelligence on the Soviet booster rocket still in relay, Mr. President.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A room packed with US MILITARY BRASS. JIM WEBB, NASA ADMINISTRATOR, a hard, powerful man, is front and center. All eyes are on the radar screen plotting the rocket’s trajectory.

dialogues.speaker: CRACKLING VOICE, (ON RADIO)
dialogues.text: Disengage booster rocket. We are go. SPACE -— CONTINUOUS The booster rocket falls back to Earth, as the dislodged capsule floats at us, into the black of space. Script provided for educational purposes. More scripts ca  Hidden Figures - 5/9/2016 - Shooting Draft - 11 . INT. NASA TRACKING CONTROL ROOM - HAMPTON, VA - CONT. Al Harrison stands in a control room packed with ENGINEER He leans forward, owl-eyed on the massive screens trackin the rocket. And then:

dialogues.speaker: CRACKLING VOICE, (ON RADIO)
dialogues.text: Orbital entry is...go.

dialogues.speaker: SPACE
dialogues.text: The capsule twists on axis, revealing...the blood-red ham and sickle of the Soviet Union. This is Korabl-Sputnik-4. The Russian Military Communication crackles in:

dialogues.speaker: RUSSIAN MILITARY ANNOUNCER, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: (in Russian, with English subtitles) All systems safe. Confirmed. Orbital entry is established.

dialogues.speaker: THE OVAL OFFICE
dialogues.text: President Kennedy rubs his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: US CENTRAL COMMAND
dialogues.text: Dire mood. Jim Webb picks up a ringing phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harrison, distraught, walks out of the room.

dialogues.speaker: A SCREENING ROOM
dialogues.text: A black and white film reel plays. It’s a Russian Press Conference. A RUSSIAN SCIENTIST is holding a small, wiry dog in a cosmonaut vest. This is ZVEZDOCHKA, the world’s first spa traveler: a Jack Russell Terrier mix. He barks.

dialogues.speaker: RUSSIAN SCIENTIST
dialogues.text: (in Russian, subtitled in English) Zvezdochka is ready to go again. (motions to his side) So is our comrade, Ivan. Next to the Scientist: a mannequin with a placard, IVAN IVANOVICH, is propped up in a chair, dressed as a cosmona The Russian press laughs. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Script provided for educational purposes. More scripts ca  Hidden Figures - 5/9/2016 - Shooting Draft - 12 .

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: RUSSIAN SCIENTIST (CONT’D) Now it is time. Mother Russia will be first to put a human in space. The hoarse voice of Jim Webb breaks in:

dialogues.speaker: JIM WEBB, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: A goddamn dog! And a goddamn mannequin! Webb steps up out of his seat, the news reel plays across back. The screening room is packed with MILITARY BRASS an NASA ENGINEERS. Including: Al Harrison, Lead Engineer, PA STAFFORD, Associate Engineer, SAM TURNER, and Harrison's Secretary, RUTH.

dialogues.speaker: JIM WEBB, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: And then a 1.6 megaton RDS-37 thermonuclear warhead drops down in the middle of Des Moines. Harrison stands, holds up his hand. The news reel abruptl stops. Lights come up. It’s funeral wake quiet. Until, Paul Stafford speaks out of turn.

dialogues.speaker: PAUL STAFFORD
dialogues.text: Well, that’s a pretty big jump, sir. Bad move. Webb turns to Stafford.

dialogues.speaker: JIM WEBB
dialogues.text: Who the hell is he? Harrison defends his man.

dialogues.speaker: AL HARRISON
dialogues.text: Paul Stafford...our Lead Engineer, Mr. Webb. I think what he meant to say is that speculation, at least on our side of the equation, can be dangerous. Webb wags a finger at Stafford.

dialogues.speaker: JIM WEBB
dialogues.text: You know what’s dangerous...inaction. Inaction and indecision. The Russians have a spy satellite lapping the planet. Taking pictures of God knows what. The President is demanding an immediate response. No more delays. Alan Shepard, John Glenn, your uncle Bob. Doesn’t matter, just get us up there, Harrison. We can’t justify a space program that doesn't put anything in space. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Script provided for educational purposes. More scripts ca  Hidden Figures - 5/9/2016 - Shooting Draft - 13 .

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Webb walks out. A mass exodus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Footsteps echo off the marble floor, as Harrison walks wi Paul Stafford, Sam Turner, Ruth, and the rest of the TEAM

dialogues.speaker: AL HARRISON
dialogues.text: (to Stafford) How did that feel in there, Paul? Do you think you enlightened the Administrator? Stafford has no response. AL HARRISON (CONT’D) He didn’t look enlightened to me. Harrison stops. He cleans his glasses. Addresses SAM. AL HARRISON (CONT’D) He look enlightened to you, Sam?

dialogues.speaker: SAM TURNER
dialogues.text: Not particularly. Paul nods. Harrison walks away. The Team keeps up.

dialogues.speaker: AL HARRISON
dialogues.text: And just so you know, he’s not wrong about what he said in there. You know that, right? Because now that they can get up there, a bomb will follow. That’s what happens to all our good ideas. Harrison stops again. Stands in front of a window staring something we can’t see. He’s quiet for the longest time. AL HARRISON (CONT’D) Where’s the machine?

dialogues.speaker: RUTH
dialogues.text: Any day now, Mr. Harrison.

dialogues.speaker: AL HARRISON
dialogues.text: Any day now. What’s it called? The initials...the letters

dialogues.speaker: PAUL STAFFORD
dialogues.text: International business machine. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Script provided for educational purposes. More scripts ca  Hidden Figures - 5/9/2016 - Shooting Draft - 14 .

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Harrison jots a note in a mini notebook.

dialogues.speaker: AL HARRISON
dialogues.text: Space is business. I needa mathematician.

dialogues.speaker: RUTH
dialogues.text: I'll put in another request, sir.

dialogues.speaker: AL HARRISON
dialogues.text: Another request. Jesus Christ. We don’t have a single person, in this entire building, that can handle Analytic Geometry?

dialogues.speaker: RUTH
dialogues.text: That’s what I’ve been told.

dialogues.speaker: AL HARRISON
dialogues.text: Well, tell me something else, Ruth. Like we're going to find such a person, before the Russians plant a flag on the damn moon. He walks off again. Mumbling. The Team hustles after him. We stay at the window Harrison was staring into. It’s a stark white clean room. Bright...and empty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nondescript brick. A sign reads: West Computing Group. TW PROFESSIONAL BLACK WOMEN lead us in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is the other side of the tracks at NASA. No white marble here. Concrete floor, no frills. We push toward a door labeled: “West Computers,” as the two Black Women en

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The West Computing Room is a dumpy rectangle of long tabl and mismatched chairs below a “Colored Computers” sign. Dorothy stands in front of TWO DOZEN BLACK COMPUTERS, wom of all shapes and sizes, assigning the day’s work. Kather and Mary stand in back.

dialogues.speaker: DOROTHY
dialogues.text: Eleanor you’re with Bernie today in Data Reduction, Building 202. Ugh. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Script provided for educational purposes. More scripts ca  Hidden Figures - 5/9/2016 - Shooting Draft - 15 .

dialogues.speaker: ELEANOR
dialogues.text: Date Reduction?!

dialogues.speaker: DOROTHY
dialogues.text: You're welcome to join the charmers in Magnetoplasmadynamics. Eleanor hops up.

dialogues.speaker: ELEANOR
dialogues.text: No thank you, ma’am. Data Reduction’s just fine. Dorothy holds out paperwork. Eleanor takes it. Heads to t door.

dialogues.speaker: DOROTHY
dialogues.text: Mary. Mary raises her hand like a school girl.

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: Present.

dialogues.speaker: DOROTHY
dialogues.text: The Mercury 7 prototype has arrived for testing. Mr. Zielinski’s requesting you...for permanent assignment. Mary can’t contain herself. This is big news.

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: Are you serious?

dialogues.speaker: DOROTHY
dialogues.text: Get moving. Mary literally jumps to the front of the room. Takes her paperwork.

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: Thank you. Thank you! Thank you, Jesus!

dialogues.speaker: DOROTHY
dialogues.text: (privately) Keep it inside, hon. The other girls... Mary tempers her boisterousness. Buttons it up.

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: Sorry, Dor. Mary winks at her. Dorothy shakes her head. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Script provided for educational purposes. More scripts ca  Hidden Figures - 5/9/2016 - Shooting Draft - 16 .

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Just then, in walks: VIVIAN MITCHELL, Supervisor of Femal Computers, flanked by her ASSISTANT. Armfuls of worksheet and graph pads. The Group snaps to attention.

dialogues.speaker: DOROTHY
dialogues.text: Mrs. Mitchell.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN MITCHELL
dialogues.text: We’re on double time this mornin’, girls. I need these calculations before lunch. Vivian's Assistant dumps the workload on the table. Thud. Vivian hands Dorothy an assignment sheet. VIVIAN MITCHELL (CONT’D) The Space Task Group needs a computer ASAP. Someone with a handle on Analytic Geometry. Much to my chagrin, we can’t fill the position outta the East Group.

dialogues.speaker: DOROTHY
dialogues.text: Permanent or temp?

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN MITCHELL
dialogues.text: Everything's temporary, Dorothy. You have someone? Dorothy doesn't hesitate:

dialogues.speaker: DOROTHY
dialogues.text: Yes, ma’am. Katherine’s the gal for that. Vivian looks the room over. Katherine raises her hand, squirms: the Space Task Group is the ‘be all.’ DOROTHY (CONT’D) She can handle any numbers you put in front of her. Vivian sizes Katherine up.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN MITCHELL
dialogues.text: I’ll check her credentials. And with that, Vivian swoops off. Assistant behind her. VIVIAN MITCHELL (CONT’D) Didn't think of comin’ all the way down here. They exit. Script provided for educational purposes. More scripts ca  Hidden Figures - 5/9/2016 - Shooting Draft - 17 . THE WEST HALLWAY —- MOMENTS LATER Vivian and her Assistant walk away from the Computing Roo Dorothy comes out, catches up.

dialogues.speaker: DOROTHY
dialogues.text: Mrs. Mitchell...if I could- Vivian stops. Turns back. DOROTHY (CONT’D) My application for supervisor, ma‘am. Was wondering if they’re still considering me for that position.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN MITCHELL
dialogues.text: Yes. Well, the official word is: no. They're not assignin’ a permanent supervisor to the Colored Group. Dorothy is sunk.

dialogues.speaker: DOROTHY
dialogues.text: I see. May I ask why?

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN MITCHELL
dialogues.text: I don’t know “why.” I didn’t ask “why.”

dialogues.speaker: DOROTHY
dialogues.text: We need a Supervisor, ma’am. Haven't had one since Ms. Jansen got sick. Been almost a year.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN MITCHELL
dialogues.text: Things are workin’ just fine as is, Dorothy.

dialogues.speaker: DOROTHY
dialogues.text: I do the work of a Supervisor. I’m in charge of the Group, like a Supervisor.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN MITCHELL
dialogues.text: That's NASA, for ya. Fast with rocket ships. Slow with advancement. (changes the subject) Get those trajectories calcs worked out. We need ‘em for the Redstone test. Vivian walks off. Dorothy simmers inside. Script provided for educational purposes. More scripts ca  Hidden Figures - 5/9/2016 - Shooting Draft - 18 .

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sun bounces off the massive, silver spheres that hous the wind tunnels. Mary, arms loaded with reports and worksheets, walks briskly underneath the turbines.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mary scoots down the hallway leading to the tunnel. She stops at the edge: for the first time she sees the Mercur prototype capsule suspended in mid-air. Her eyes twinkle the sight.

dialogues.speaker: THE WIND TUNNEL
dialogues.text: Mary ambles under the Mercury 7 capsule. She inspects eve single bolt, every shingle. This is why she’s here. This why she works at NASA. A PA announcement jars her back to reality:

dialogues.speaker: PA ANNOUNCER
dialogues.text: Mach 2 tunnel test, T-minus one minute. Red lights flash, a siren spins. Mary hustles off, throug the tunnel. As fans start to whir. Wind builds. She's almost at the end, when she missteps off the path. of her high heels gets caught in the grating.

dialogues.speaker: THE WIND TUNNEL CONTROL ROOM
dialogues.text: Chief Wind Tunnel Engineer: KARL ZIELINSKI, 50s, Polish J stares down from the glass control booth. He sees Mary struggling with the shoe.

dialogues.speaker: THE WIND TUNNEL
dialogues.text: The wind picks up. Mary’s in a state. Fighting with the shoe. A voice over the PA shocks her:

dialogues.speaker: ZIELINSKI, (OVER THE PA)
dialogues.text: No shoe is worth your life. Mary looks up at the control booth. Sees Zielinski starin down at her.

dialogues.speaker: PA ANNOUNCER
dialogues.text: Mach 2 tunnel test, T-minus ten, nine, eight... Mary pulls her foot out of the shoe and runs one-shoed, hobbling toward the exit. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Script provided for educational purposes. More scripts ca  Hidden Figures - 5/9/2016 - Shooting Draft - 19 .

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: PA ANNOUNCER (CONT’D) Seven, six, five... Mary steps out of the tunnel. Just as the wind becomes deafening.

dialogues.speaker: THE WIND TUNNEL CONTROL ROOM
dialogues.text: Zielinski and WIND TUNNEL ENGINEERS watch the Mach 2 test The Mercury 7 capsule is engulfed in forceful winds. It shakes. Rattles. Groans. Mary comes up behind Zielinski. The bolts strain on the heat shield. Pop! One of them pops off, a shingle flies off the heat shield, hits the control booth window. Crash. Engineers jump. Then another two break off. Crash. Crash. A few more. Bang. Bang. Zielinski holds up his hand.

dialogues.speaker: ZIELINSKI
dialogues.text: Shut it down. The wind subsides.

dialogues.speaker: THE WIND TUNNEL
dialogues.text: Zielinski and Mary are walking around the Mercury 7 capsu Inspecting. Mary’s taking notes.

dialogues.speaker: ZIELINSKI
dialogues.text: If we alter the exterior from smooth to corrugated, the capsule would have more stability, despite the air displacement. He stops, touches an indent in the heat shield.

dialogues.speaker: ZIELINSKI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: But the friction it’s under during re- entry...heat trumps wind. It’s less predictable. Note: most shield erosion occurs on the posterior side abutting the retro-boosters. Conclusion? Mary looks up from taking notes:

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: The area closest to the boosters is closest to the heat. (MORE ) (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Script provided for educational purposes. More scripts ca  Hidden Figures - 5/9/2016 - Shooting Draft - 20 .

dialogues.speaker: MARY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Coupled with rising temperatures on re- entry, the contacts soften. We could consider another fastener other than bolts. Zielinski nods approval. Inspects another section of the capsule.

dialogues.speaker: ZIELINSKI
dialogues.text: There’s another opening in the Engineer Training Program. She’s heard this before. Deflects.

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: Flat head rivets could reduce wind drag. He turns to her. Serious.

dialogues.speaker: ZIELINSKI
dialogues.text: Mary...a person with an engineer’s mind should be an engineer. You can’t be a Computer the rest of your life. That would be a tragic waste of your ability.

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: Mr. Zielinski, I’m a Negro woman. I’m not going to entertain the impossible.

dialogues.speaker: ZIELINSKI
dialogues.text: And I'm a polish Jew whose parents died in a Nazi prison camp. Now I’m standing beneath a space ship that’s going to carry an astronaut to the stars. I think we can say, we’re living the impossible. Let me ask...if you were a white male, would you wish to be an engineer? Mary doesn’t need to think.

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: I wouldn’t have to. I’d already be one

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vivian Mitchell leads Katherine down an endless white hallway. Briefing her:

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN MITCHELL
dialogues.text: Skirts must be worn past the knee. Sweaters are preferred to blouses. No jewelry. A simple pearl necklace is the exception. (MORE ) (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Script provided for educational purposes. More scripts ca  Hidden Figures - 5/9/2016 - Shooting Draft - 21 .

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN MITCHELL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Your supervisor is Mr. Al Harrison, Director of the Space Task Group. You’ll write research, proof calculations, so forth. Don’t talk to Mr. Harrison lest he talks to you. Not many Computers last more than a few days, he’s been through a dozen in as many months. (hands her a lanyard) Your clearance. Katherine takes the lanyard. She’s overwhelmed. They arri at steel doors labeled: Space Task Group. VIVIAN MITCHELL (CONT’D) They've never had a colored in here before, Katherine. Don’t embarrass me. Vivian walks off, leaving Katherine alone. She takes a de breath. Walks into her future.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Katherine steps into a cyclone of activity and stress. ENGINEERS chalk equations on blackboards, slug coffee. AI and SUPPORT STAFF scurry, answer phones. This is the Spac Task Group: the world’s most exclusive scientific club. At the back of the room, Harrison paces in his glass bubb talking with Karl Zielinski. For the briefest moment, everyone seems to be looking at black woman who just entered their world. But it’s just a passing moment, there’s far too much to do. Engineer Sam Turner hands Katherine a trash can.

dialogues.speaker: SAM TURNER
dialogues.text: This wasn’t emptied last night.

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE
dialogues.text: I'm sorry. I’m not-— He’s gone before she can explain. Katherine sees the only other woman in this zoo: Ruth. Puts the trash can down, walks her way.

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Excuse me, ma’am, Mr. Harrison’s Computer reporting. Ruth barely looks up from beneath a pile of worksheets. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Script provided for educational purposes. More scripts ca  Hidden Figures - 5/9/2016 - Shooting Draft - 22 .

dialogues.speaker: RUTH
dialogues.text: (points, far off) Take the desk in the corner. I’11l get you work in a bit. She finally notices Katherine is...black. Pauses. Katheri smiles. Ruth considers her. Her strength. Her calm.

dialogues.speaker: RUTH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Mr. Harrison won’t warm up to you, don’t expect it. Do your work, keep your head down.

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE
dialogues.text: Thank you. Katherine lingers.

dialogues.speaker: RUTH
dialogues.text: Go on. Get settled. Katherine walks to her station, way at the back of the ro against the wall. Puts her personals on the desk. Sits. She looks at the Engineer toiling aside her, it’s Paul Stafford. He looks at Katherine. Doesn’t smile. Just studies her. Harrison (with Zielinski) steps out of his office, eating sandwich. He barks:

dialogues.speaker: AL HARRISON
dialogues.text: Stafford, why are we still losing shingles off our heat shield? Stafford damn near jumps.

dialogues.speaker: STAFFORD
dialogues.text: We're working with a prototype of the capsule, Al. It’s one third the size-

dialogues.speaker: AL HARRISON
dialogues.text: I get that. He turns to Zielinski. Dead serious. AL HARRISON (CONT’D) Well, do we need to turn our million dollar fan down, Karl?

dialogues.speaker: ZIELINSKI
dialogues.text: No, Al. I don’t think- (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Script provided for educational purposes. More scripts ca  Hidden Figures - 5/9/2016 - Shooting Draft - 23 .

dialogues.speaker: AL HARRISON
dialogues.text: Of course not. That was a joke. Back to Stafford. AL HARRISON (CONT’D) Paul. If the heat shield comes off, what do you think happens to our astronaut? Stafford nods his head. AL HARRISON (CONT’D) So we’re going to come up with a solve, right?

dialogues.speaker: STAFFORD
dialogues.text: Yes, sir. We’re working on it. Harrison moves on.

dialogues.speaker: AL HARRISON
dialogues.text: Ruth. What’s the status on my Computer?

dialogues.speaker: RUTH
dialogues.text: She's right in front of you, Mr. Harrison. Ruth motions to Katherine. Harrison gives her a once over Not what he expected either.

dialogues.speaker: AL HARRISON
dialogues.text: Does she know how to handle Analytic Geometry?

dialogues.speaker: RUTH
dialogues.text: Absolutely. And she speaks.

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE
dialogues.text: I do, sir.

dialogues.speaker: AL HARRISON
dialogues.text: Which one?

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE
dialogues.text: Both, sir. Geometry and speaking. Harrison waves a finger at Ruth.

dialogues.speaker: AL HARRISON
dialogues.text: Then give her the- (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Script provided for educational purposes. More scripts ca  Hidden Figures - 5/9/2016 - Shooting Draft - 24 .

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: She knows exactly what he’s talking about. She always kno what he’s talking about. She snatches a bundle of workshe off her desk, rushes them to Katherine. AL HARRISON (CONT’D) (to Katherine) Do you think you can find me the Frenet frame for that data using the Gram- Schmidt-- Katherine glances at the data sheets.

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE
dialogues.text: --Orthogonalization algorithm. Yes, sir. I prefer it over Euclidean coordinates. That’s all Harrison needs to hear. She knows her stuff.

dialogues.speaker: AL HARRISON
dialogues.text: Good. Then, I’m going to need it by the end of the day. And I’m also going to ask you to check Mr. Stafford’s math as well as others on this floor from time to time. Stafford rebuts.

dialogues.speaker: STAFFORD
dialogues.text: I can work that out myself, Al.

dialogues.speaker: AL HARRISON
dialogues.text: I’m sure you can, Paul. I’m sure all of you can. But if that were the case, shingles wouldn't be flying off the heat shield, now would they. Harrison walks into the center of the Task Group. AL HARRISON (CONT’D) Excuse me. I just want to be clear about something...in 14 days the Mercury 7 will be here for training and I have no doubt that they'll be asking questions about our work. Do I need to remind everyone...that we are putting a human on top of a missile and shooting him into space? It’s never been done before. And because it’s never been done...everything we do between now and then is going to matter: it’s going to matter to their wives, their kids, I believe it’s going to matter to the whole damn country. (MORE ) (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Script provided for educational purposes. More scripts ca  Hidden Figures - 5/9/2016 - Shooting Draft - 25 .

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: AL HARRISON (CONT’D) So this Space Task Group will be as advertised. And Americas greatest engineering and scientific minds will not have a problem with having their work checked. Will they, Paul? He waits. Then...nods all around. No issues. AL HARRISON (CONT’D) Good. So let’s have an amen, goddamnit.

dialogues.speaker: THE ENTIRE SPACE TASK GROUP
dialogues.text: Amen. Harrison plods off, into his office. The Group jumps back into the work. Katherine arranges her personals. Everything in it’s plac Meticulous. She looks over at a very frustrated and diminished Staffo He’s using a thick black marker to redact much of the dat a report. He feels Katherine’s gaze, and stares hostilely her until she looks away. Katherine puts her head down, opens Harrison’s bundle of worksheets. Starts to dive in. THUD. A thick report lands in front of her. She jolts. Stafford’s standing above.

dialogues.speaker: STAFFORD
dialogues.text: My numbers are spot on.

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE
dialogues.text: I’1l double check them, sir, not a problem. Katherine opens the report. The black marker redaction is bleeding through pages and pages of numbers. Can’t make o much.

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I’m not going to be able-

dialogues.speaker: STAFFORD
dialogues.text: Work on what you can read. The rest is classified. You don’t have clearance. Stafford walks off. Joins Sam and a FEW COLLEAGUES at the coffee maker. All clearly talking about Katherine. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Script provided for educational purposes. More scripts ca  Hidden Figures - 5/9/2016 - Shooting Draft - 26 .

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: She holds Stafford’s report up to the light. This is goin to be impossible. Then...her foot starts tapping, jittery. She crosses her legs. Has to pee something fierce. She walks over to Ruth, who’s on a phone call.

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE
dialogues.text: Excuse me... Ruth holds her hand over the phone.

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: May I ask you where the ladies’ room is?

dialogues.speaker: RUTH
dialogues.text: Sorry, I have no idea where your bathroom is. Ruth returns to her conversation. Katherine walks away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Katherine rushes down the hall, worksheets in her arms. Searching for a bathroom. Her papers drop. At the far end of the hall...she sees the bathrooms. Than God. She scoops the papers up. A TRIO OF WHITE WOMEN come out of the ladies’ restroom. T stand outside the door, chatting away. Damn. Katherine gathers herself, ducks down another hallw

dialogues.speaker: ANOTHER HALLWAY
dialogues.text: Katherine’s practically running. No “colored bathrooms” anywhere.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Katherine pushes through steel doors into the blinding su Sees the West Campus Building way off in the distance. 1/ mile away to be exact. She runs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Katherine sprints down the familiarly dingy West Campus h She crashes through a door labeled: “Colored Restroom.” Script provided for educational purposes. More scripts ca  Hidden Figures - 5/9/2016 - Shooting Draft - 27 .

dialogues.speaker: THE RESTROOM
dialogues.text: Katherine plops down on the toilet. She reaches down to h feet, puts the paperwork on her lap...and keeps working. Calculating numbers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Katherine runs back toward the East Campus. As fast as he legs will take her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harrison, one ear glued to a phone, plunges out of his office, looks for Katherine. Not there. He hollers at Rut

dialogues.speaker: AL HARRISON
dialogues.text: Where’s that girl with those numbers?

dialogues.speaker: RUTH
dialogues.text: On a...break.

dialogues.speaker: AL HARRISON
dialogues.text: (to himself) We take breaks now. Harrison returns to his phone call. Katherine bursts through the main door. Ruth intercepts h

dialogues.speaker: RUTH
dialogues.text: My God, where have you been? Are you finished yet?

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE
dialogues.text: I was- Almost. He said: the end of the day?

dialogues.speaker: RUTH
dialogues.text: The end of the day around here was yesterday. Ruth thrusts a double stack of worksheets at Katherine. Thrice the size of the first. Harrison’s voice booms from above.

dialogues.speaker: AL HARRISON
dialogues.text: I want those done first. Katherine startles. Harrison’s outside his office, still the phone. Then...he disappears again. Katherine inspects the stack. Shell shocked. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Script provided for educational purposes. More scripts ca  Hidden Figures - 5/9/2016 - Shooting Draft - 28 .

dialogues.speaker: RUTH
dialogues.text: He wants those done first. Get going. Katherine hustles back to her station. On her way, she se Harrison standing in his bubble, still on the phone, star right at her. She lands at her desk. Gathers herself. Opens the new worksheets: miles and miles of data. This will be the longest day of her life.

dialogues.speaker: THE COFFEE AREA
dialogues.text: Katherine's head is buried in data sheets, as she steps u the coffee counter, holding her cup. She looks around. On one coffee pot. She picks it up... Sam looks up from his desk. Sees Katherine pouring her coffee. He looks over at ANOTHER ENGINEER. They share a confused look. OTHER ENGINEERS look over. Stafford sees everyone staring, he follows their gaze to Katherine. Now stirring her coffee. Sam looks to Stafford “What the hell is she doing?” Katherine turns back, sees all the eyes on her. Puts her head down and walks back to her desk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A BLACK CLEANING LADY is wiping the coffee counter. The Space Task Group is all but abandoned...aside from Katherine working by lamp light at her desk. She finishes her last calculation. Looks up and sees: Harrison standing in his glass bubble. Scribbling on a ch board. The only other person left. She rises, takes her report. Walks up the stairs.

dialogues.speaker: HARRISON'S OFFICE
dialogues.text: Katherine taps on the glass door.

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE
dialogues.text: Mr. Harrison. Harrison waves her in.

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Here you are, sir. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Script provided for educational purposes. More scripts ca  Hidden Figures - 5/9/2016 - Shooting Draft - 29 .

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Without looking.

dialogues.speaker: AL HARRISON
dialogues.text: And Stafford’s heat shield calcs?

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE
dialogues.text: It’s hard to be sure, sir. That’s not what he needed to hear. He swivels to her.

dialogues.speaker: AL HARRISON
dialogues.text: Do you know what we’re doing here?

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE
dialogues.text: We're trying to put a man in space, sir.

dialogues.speaker: AL HARRISON
dialogues.text: That's right. So you can throw that in the trash.

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE
dialogues.text: Excuse me? Harrison gets up, moves around his desk.

dialogues.speaker: AL HARRISON
dialogues.text: I said you can throw it away. He gently takes it out of Katherine’s confused hands. AL HARRISON (CONT’D) Here. Harrison drops her report on top of a trash can overflowi with dozens of similar reports and worksheets. It’s a graveyard of obsolete work. AL HARRISON (CONT’D) It's not an insult to your work. Harrison goes back to the board. Obsessed with the number the logistics. AL HARRISON (CONT’D) It's just obsolete. That's how fast things are moving. If I said I was sorry, I'd be saying it all day. Katherine’s immobile. Floored. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Script provided for educational purposes. More scripts ca  Hidden Figures - 5/9/2016 - Shooting Draft - 30 .

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: AL HARRISON (CONT’D) What I’m asking you..what I’m asking everyone one in that room, all my geniuses, is to look beyond the numbers. To look around them. Through them. For answers to questions we don’t even know to ask. Math that doesn’t yet exist. He studies the math. AL HARRISON (CONT’D) Because without it, we’re not going anywhere. We're staying on the ground. We're not flying into space...we’re not circling the earth. And we're certainly not touching the moon. And in my mind...I’m already there. Katherine has no words. AL HARRISON (CONT’D) Are you?

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE
dialogues.text: Yes, sir

dialogues.speaker: AL HARRISON
dialogues.text: Good. Because I don’t need another smart girl with a calculator. Harrison stops abruptly, takes off his glasses. Cleans th Katherine is lost. Finally:

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE
dialogues.text: Can I go, sir? Harrison remembers she’s in the room. Turns back:

dialogues.speaker: AL HARRISON
dialogues.text: Oh. Yes. Yes. Go home. He turns back to the board. Mumbles to himself.

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE
dialogues.text: Good night, sir. Katherine walks to the door. Harrison starts calculating the board. Too engrossed to say good night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Katherine walks down the lonely white hallway. She shakes her fists in frustration. Script provided for educational purposes. More scripts ca  Hidden Figures - 5/9/2016 - Shooting Draft - 31 .

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Katherine pushes out a door, into the parking lot. She’s relieved to see: Dorothy and Mary leaning on the back of Dorothy’s car. Katherine smiles in relief.

dialogues.speaker: DOROTHY
dialogues.text: We've been waiting for hours. Next time you catch a bus. Dorothy steps into the car, starts it up. Mary holds a do open for Katherine.

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: (re: Dorothy) She’s in a mood. Katherine and Mary hop in the car. INT. DOROTHY’S CAR - LATER Dorothy drives. Katherine’s in back. Mary’s shotgun, with her feet on the dash. The car is their sanctuary.

dialogues.speaker: DOROTHY
dialogues.text: I haven't been late one day in ten years. Haven't been out sick. Haven't complained. My work’s on time. It’s done right. It’s done well.

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: It’s not fair, that’s a fact.

dialogues.speaker: DOROTHY
dialogues.text: What’s not fair is having the responsibility of a Supervisor, but not the title or the money. Watching you all get moved on. Now don’t get me wrong, any upward movement is movement for us all. It just isn’t movement for me.

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE
dialogues.text: Truth be told, Dorothy, I don’t know if I can keep up in that room. I'’11 be back with the Computers in a week, or out of a job entirely.

dialogues.speaker: DOROTHY
dialogues.text: Oh, please. You’re better with the numbers than anyone in there and you know it. Make that pencil move as fast as your mind does, you'll be fine. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Script provided for educational purposes. More scripts ca  Hidden Figures - 5/9/2016 - Shooting Draft - 32 .

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Dorothy swats Mary’s feet off her dashboard. DOROTHY (CONT’D) And you. Have some respect. Get your damn feet off my dash board. This isn’t your living room. Mary sits up straight. Katherine sinks back in her seat. It’s quiet. For a long time. Then: DOROTHY (CONT’D) I sound like a supervisor, don’t I? Dorothy smiles wryly. Mary and Katherine breathe.

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: A mean, ole salty one.

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE
dialogues.text: Riddled with authority. No question.

dialogues.speaker: DOROTHY
dialogues.text: You don’t mess with, Mrs. Vaughan. Dorothy turns the music up. EXT. KATHERINE’S HOUSE - NIGHT - LATER Katherine’s tiny, single-family brick house is modest but well-appointed. She drags up the walkway, waves goodbye t Dorothy and Mary pulling off the curb. INT. KATHERINE’S HOUSE - LIVING ROOM - CONTINUOUS Katherine steps inside. The only light shines from the kitchen, where her mother, JOYLETTE, is doing dishes.

dialogues.speaker: JOYLETTE COLEMAN
dialogues.text: My word, Katherine. I was fixing to call the National Guard. Katherine kisses her mom.

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE
dialogues.text: Sorry, Momma. New assignment. The Space Task Group.

dialogues.speaker: JOYLETTE COLEMAN
dialogues.text: That sounds important. It’s a promotion?

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE
dialogues.text: It’s important and overwhelming...maybe a slight promotion. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Script provided for educational purposes. More scripts ca  Hidden Figures - 5/9/2016 - Shooting Draft - 33 .

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Joylette smiles at her daughter. Always the encourager.

dialogues.speaker: JOYLETTE COLEMAN
dialogues.text: You want the job, right?

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE
dialogues.text: I think so. It’s a challenge.

dialogues.speaker: JOYLETTE COLEMAN
dialogues.text: Nothing you can’t do, Katherine. Katherine lights up. Joylette’s happy to see a spark in h daughter’s eye.

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE
dialogues.text: Are they sleeping already?

dialogues.speaker: JOYLETTE COLEMAN
dialogues.text: They're pretending to. They want their Momma . Katherine smiles. INT. KID’S BEDROOM - CONTINUOUS Katherine peeks into the tiny bedroom. One unoccupied dou bed. And one twin bed where her daughter JOYLETTE (10) is pushing back against CONSTANCE (8), and KATHY (6), who ar trying with all their might to shove Joylette from the be Katherine steps in, stops the madness.

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE
dialogues.text: What are you doing!?

dialogues.speaker: CONSTANCE
dialogues.text: It’s not fair Joylette always gets to sleep by herself ‘cause she’s the oldest.

dialogues.speaker: JOYLETTE, (10)
dialogues.text: It is too fair!

dialogues.speaker: KATHY
dialogues.text: Nuh unh! Katherine nods calmly, sits on the double bed. Pats it.

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE
dialogues.text: Constance, Kathy, come sit. Constance and Kathy sit on either side of her. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Script provided for educational purposes. More scripts ca  Hidden Figures - 5/9/2016 - Shooting Draft - 34 .

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I understand you want to be grown. And you want your own space. So I’m willing to change the rules--

dialogues.speaker: JOYLETTE, (10)
dialogues.text: Momma ! Katherine shoots her a look. Joylette quiets.

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE
dialogues.text: Whoever sleeps in that bed in, Joylette’s place, will also dry the dishes, take out the trash, and do all the rest of Joylette’s choirs. Constance and Kathy would rather die!

dialogues.speaker: KATHY
dialogues.text: That’s okay. Never mind.

dialogues.speaker: CONSTANCE
dialogues.text: She’s not so terrible to share with. As Constance and Kathy get into bed, Katherine winks at Joylette. Joylette smiles.

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE
dialogues.text: Now don’t let me come home, find you like this again. You should have been asleep. A long time ago.

dialogues.speaker: JOYLETTE, (10)
dialogues.text: We just wanted to say “good night.”

dialogues.speaker: KATHY
dialogues.text: You’ve been gone for 300 hours. Katherine steps to Kathy’s side of the bed.

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE
dialogues.text: I work full time now. You all know that. I have to be the mommy and the daddy. Just the mention of “daddy”...instant quiet. Long faces. Katherine sits on the edge of Constance and Kathy’s bed.

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I miss your father as much as anyone.

dialogues.speaker: KATHY
dialogues.text: He’s with his angels. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Script provided for educational purposes. More scripts ca  Hidden Figures - 5/9/2016 - Shooting Draft - 35 .

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE
dialogues.text: That's right. He’s with all his angels.

dialogues.speaker: CONSTANCE
dialogues.text: And he’s watching over us.

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE
dialogues.text: Every minute. She tucks Kathy in.

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: So, we're going to be strong. We’re done crying about it. We have to all do our part now. Which means you have to go to bed like big girls. On your own. Understand?

dialogues.speaker: ALL THREE SIBLINGS
dialogues.text: Yes, Momma. Katherine moves over to Constance. Tucks her in.

dialogues.speaker: CONSTANCE
dialogues.text: Are the Russians fixing to attack us?

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE
dialogues.text: Where’d you hear that?

dialogues.speaker: CONSTANCE
dialogues.text: My teacher. She said they’re putting spies and nuclear bombs up in space. Joylette (10) cuts in.

dialogues.speaker: JOYLETTE, (10)
dialogues.text: We had to stay under our desks this morning. All scrunched up.

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE
dialogues.text: That's just a drill. A precaution. Truth is, we don’t know what they're doing up there. Katherine moves to Joylette (10), tucks her in.

dialogues.speaker: CONSTANCE
dialogues.text: Are you going up to space too, Momma?

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE
dialogues.text: No, baby. But I’m going to help those brave men do it. The best I can. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Script provided for educational purposes. More scripts ca  Hidden Figures - 5/9/2016 - Shooting Draft - 36 .

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Kathy pulls out a picture she drew of Katherine in space. Hands it to her.

dialogues.speaker: KATHY
dialogues.text: You could fly to space too if you wanted to, Momma. You could be an astronaut. Katherine’s touched. She smiles at her babies. Kisses the

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE
dialogues.text: Thank you, baby. Now this time...really go to bed. She turns off the lamp.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Picturesque, white church for an all black congregation.

dialogues.speaker: THE CHURCH SERVICE
dialogues.text: Sunday morning. Everyone’s on their feet. The room is packed with FAMILIES. Amongst them: Katherine, Joylette (Mom) and the kids; Mary, her husband LEVI and their kids (LEVI, JR.(5) and CAROLYN MARIE (4)); and Dorothy and her husband, HOWARD and their kids (ANN (16), KATHRYN (14), LEONARD (9) and KENNETH (7)). The charismatic, PASTOR AYERS, afire, preaches from the h

dialogues.speaker: PASTOR AYRES
dialogues.text: Praise God that change is coming. From the Southern Christian Leadership Conference, to the good Reverend Dr. King, to the students sitting in at lunch counters in North Carolina. Amens all around. PASTOR AYRES (CONT’D) His faith in us has no limit! The good Lord has our very own women workin’ on rocket ships! All eyes turn to our women. Here they stand proud, here they’re revered. PASTOR AYRES (CONT’D) And we have National Guardsman defending our freedom! On the front row, a tall drink of water, NATIONAL GUARD COLONEL JIM JOHNSON, bows his head in recognition. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Script provided for educational purposes. More scripts ca  Hidden Figures - 5/9/2016 - Shooting Draft - 37 .

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: PASTOR AYRES (CONT’D) Give a shout of praise for: Colonel Jim Johnson. Returning home by the grace of God, to set up a National Guard unit right here in Hampton! Cheers and claps. PASTOR AYRES (CONT’D) Can I get a “Hallelujah” in here?! Refrains.

dialogues.speaker: BEHIND THE CHURCH
dialogues.text: An after service banquet: PARISHIONERS everywhere enjoyin outdoor pot-luck. Mary and her husband, Levi are serving their Kids. A hush argument:

dialogues.speaker: LEVI JACKSON
dialogues.text: Now you want to be an engineer? A female engineer. We’re Negro, baby. Ain’t no such thing. Understand it.

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: It’s not like that there, Levi.

dialogues.speaker: LEVI JACKSON
dialogues.text: The only real chance we’re gonna have is when we fight back. You can’t “apply” for freedom. Freedom is never granted to the oppressed. It’s got to be demanded. Taken.

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: Levi, please. Stop quoting your slogans at me. I’ve heard them all. There’s more than one way to achieve something. Levi, Jr. interrupts: LEVI JR. I don’t want any greens.

dialogues.speaker: LEVI JACKSON
dialogues.text: I tell you about interruptin’? Mary steps in, replaces the greens with mac and cheese.

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: Try this, baby. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Script provided for educational purposes. More scripts ca  Hidden Figures - 5/9/2016 - Shooting Draft - 38 .

dialogues.speaker: LEVI JACKSON
dialogues.text: He’s gonna eat the greens too. Levi pushes the greens back on his son’s plate. LEVI JACKSON (CONT’D) Kid needs to eat vegetables. You would know that, if you were home. Mary has heard enough.

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: You better settle, Levi Jackson. Less you want this female’s mind right here, front of everybody. Levi backs down. Hell hath no fury...

dialogues.speaker: LEVI JACKSON
dialogues.text: All I’m saying, don’t play a fool. I don’t want to see you get hurt. NASA’s never given you gals your due, having another degree won’t change that. Civil rights ain't always civil. He walks off. Mary serves greens to her daughter, Carolyn Cuts her off before she can complain:

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: No lip, little miss. Your brother gets them, so do you.

dialogues.speaker: PICNIC TABLES
dialogues.text: Katherine and Dorothy are feeding their Kids, trying to h a conversation.

dialogues.speaker: DOROTHY
dialogues.text: I hear he’s planning on staying in the area.

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE
dialogues.text: That's good for him. Mary walks up, cuts in:

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: Katherine, go find your way over there. That Colonel Jim’s a tall glass of water. Across the green: Jim Johnson's talking to Dorothy’s husb Howard. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Script provided for educational purposes. More scripts ca  Hidden Figures - 5/9/2016 - Shooting Draft - 39 .

dialogues.speaker: DOROTHY
dialogues.text: That he is. Tall. Strong. Commanding.

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: Probably like that day...and night.

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE
dialogues.text: Mary, it’s Sunday. Have some shame.

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: I will not. They laugh. Jim Johnson smiles over at Katherine.

dialogues.speaker: DOROTHY
dialogues.text: I think he’s smiling over here.

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: (to Katherine) At you. Katherine looks. Yep.

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE
dialogues.text: I’m not smiling back. Dorothy and Mary look at Katherine.

dialogues.speaker: DOROTHY
dialogues.text: Yes, you are.

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: You're all teeth right now.

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE
dialogues.text: I am not. She is. Katherine turns away.

dialogues.speaker: DOROTHY
dialogues.text: He’s coming this way.

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE
dialogues.text: Why’s he doing that?

dialogues.speaker: DOROTHY
dialogues.text: Mary’s waving him over. Sure enough, Mary's waving him over.

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE
dialogues.text: Ladies, I don’t know if I’m- (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Script provided for educational purposes. More scripts ca  Hidden Figures - 5/9/2016 - Shooting Draft - 40 .

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: Too late. Fix your hair on the side. Jim Johnson arrives. Dorothy wastes no time:

dialogues.speaker: DOROTHY
dialogues.text: Hello, Colonel. I’m Dorothy Vaughan. This is Mary Jackson. I believe you met her husband, Levi. Jim nods hellos.

dialogues.speaker: JIM JOHNSON
dialogues.text: Yes, ma’am. Good to meet ya’ll.

dialogues.speaker: DOROTHY
dialogues.text: And this is Katherine Goble. Jim and Katherine lock eyes. Mary blurts out:

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: She’s not married. She’s a widow. With three little girls, so well-behaved. Angels on earth, we call ‘em. She can tell you the rest. Dorothy, slice-a pie?

dialogues.speaker: DOROTHY
dialogues.text: I’d love one. And with that, Mary and Dorothy leave Katherine alone wit Colonel Jim. He smiles at her.

dialogues.speaker: THE GROUNDS
dialogues.text: Katherine and Jim are walking through the grass.

dialogues.speaker: JIM JOHNSON
dialogues.text: Pastor mentioned you’re a “Computer” at NASA. What’s that entail?

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE
dialogues.text: We calculate the mathematics necessary to enable launch and landing for the Space Program.

dialogues.speaker: JIM JOHNSON
dialogues.text: Aeronautics. Pretty heady stuff. They let women handle that kind of- He stops himself. Too late. Backpedals. JIM JOHNSON (CONT’D) Well. That’s not what I mean. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Script provided for educational purposes. More scripts ca  Hidden Figures - 5/9/2016 - Shooting Draft - 41 .

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE
dialogues.text: What do you mean?

dialogues.speaker: JIM JOHNSON
dialogues.text: I was just surprised something so...taxing- Katherine stops him.

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE
dialogues.text: Mr. Johnson, it may be best if you quit talking right now.

dialogues.speaker: JIM JOHNSON
dialogues.text: I’m not meaning any disrespect-

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE
dialogues.text: I‘1l have you know, I was the first Negro female student at West Virginia University Graduate School. On any given day I analyze the manometer levels for air displacement, friction and velocity and compute over 10,000 calculations by cosine, square root and lately Analytic Geometry. By hand. There are 20 bright, highly capable Negro women in the West Computing Group. And we’re proud to be doing our part for the country. Katherine adjusts her glasses.

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: So, yes...they let women do some things over at NASA, Mr. Johnson. But it’s not because we wear skirts...it’s because we wear glasses. She walks off. Jim Johnson watches her go, he’s speechles And very, very enticed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The energy of a parade. A MARCHING BAND plays, You're a Grand Old Flag. A MILITARY MOTORCADE roars to a stop, and out step the gu of honor: The Mercury 7 Astronauts: ALAN SHEPARD, GUS

dialogues.speaker: GRISSOM, JOHN GLENN, SCOTT CARPENTER, WALLY SCHIRRA, GORD
dialogues.text: COOPER, and DEKE SLAYTON. Harrison's the first to greet the Mercury 7. Shaking hand Making introductions. Ruth and Sam are amongst the welcom committee. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Script provided for educational purposes. More scripts ca  Hidden Figures - 5/9/2016 - Shooting Draft - 42 .

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: The entire NASA STAFF is lined up in the parking lot. A receiving line. At the end of this very long line of WHIT MALE NASA EMPLOYEES...we find WHITE FEMALE NASA EMPLOYEES And after that...our “Colored Computers.” Dorothy’s first, proudly next to Katherine and Mary. She bios the Astronauts for Katherine and Mary.

dialogues.speaker: DOROTHY
dialogues.text: Alan Shepard. US Navy pilot. He could be the first man in space. Alan Shepard waves at the Crowd. DOROTHY (CONT’D) That’s Scott Carpenter and Walter Schirra. Also Navy pilots. Shots of the Mercury 7 intercut. DOROTHY (CONT’D) All under 5'11”, 180 lbs. IQs over 130.

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: Handsome must be a requirement too.

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE
dialogues.text: How can you possibly be ogling these white men?

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: It’s equal rights. I have the right to see fine in every color. Harrison leads the Astronauts down the receiving line. Jo Glenn shakes hands.

dialogues.speaker: DOROTHY
dialogues.text: That’s John Glenn. The only Marine Corps pilot. A dashing John Glenn shakes a NASA ENGINEER’s hand. DOROTHY (CONT’D) And those three there are Airforce: Gus Grissom, Gordon Cooper and Deke Slayton. The Mercury Team lands in front of Vivian Mitchell and th East Computers. Handshakes. Ruth ends the procession.

dialogues.speaker: RUTH
dialogues.text: Gentlemen, if we may...much to see around here. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Script provided for educational purposes. More scripts ca  Hidden Figures - 5/9/2016 - Shooting Draft - 43 .

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: The Mercury Team follows Ruth. John Glenn catches Dorothy staring at him from the end of the line. He stops.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN GLENN
dialogues.text: Heck, haven’t shaken all the hands yet.

dialogues.speaker: RUTH
dialogues.text: We have a fairly tight itinerary, Colonel.

dialogues.speaker: AL HARRISON
dialogues.text: (lets her know it’s okay) Ruth- Too late, John Glenn’s already gone. Heading to the end o the line. The Mercury Team follows.

dialogues.speaker: DOROTHY
dialogues.text: Sweet mother of mercy. They’re coming this way.

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE
dialogues.text: Look straight ahead.

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: Shoot, look right at ‘em. Mary stares at the Astronauts as they approach. Vivian se them headed to Mary, Katherine and Dorothy’s way. Hmm. John Glenn stops in front of Dorothy.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN GLENN
dialogues.text: Ladies. Didn’t wanna run off without saying hello. They seem to be in a big rush around here. Dorothy looks him in the eyes.

dialogues.speaker: DOROTHY
dialogues.text: The Russians certainly aren’t slowing down any. He smiles. Jokes:

dialogues.speaker: JOHN GLENN
dialogues.text: They can’t make a damn ‘frigerator, how the heck they beat us into space? Dorothy laughs. John Glenn offers his hand. They shake. H moves on to Katherine. Holds out his hand. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Script provided for educational purposes. More scripts ca  Hidden Figures - 5/9/2016 - Shooting Draft - 44 .

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: JOHN GLENN (CONT’D) What do you gals do for NASA?

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE
dialogues.text: Calculate your trajectories, sir. Launch and landing.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN GLENN
dialogues.text: Can’t get anywhere without the numbers.

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE
dialogues.text: No, sir. He offers Mary his hand. She doesn’t wait for the introduction.

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: Mary Jackson, Mr. Glenn. Engineering. Proud as the devil to be workin’ with you.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN GLENN
dialogues.text: Thank you, Mary. He smiles at her. Mary could faint. John Glenn moves down the line. Shaking hands. The other Astronauts follow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A press conference. Camera flashbulbs pop incessantly. Th Mercury 7 Astronauts sit at a table in front of DOZENS OF REPORTERS and NEWS CAMERAS. A REPORTER hollers out to John Glenn:

dialogues.speaker: REPORTER
dialogues.text: Colonel Glenn, medical experts have stated that a man cannot survive in Zero- G. What are your feelings on the dangers of space flight? Are you scared at all? John Glenn leans down to his mic.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN GLENN
dialogues.text: Well. I only discuss my ‘feelings’ with the Missus. Laughter. They love these men. JOHN GLENN (CONT’D) I believe I can speak for all of us on this: we’ve been flying most of our lives. (MORE ) (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Script provided for educational purposes. More scripts ca  Hidden Figures - 5/9/2016 - Shooting Draft - 45 .

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: JOHN GLENN (CONT’D) We're honored to serve our country. That's what we signed up for. We don’t think about the dangers or have the time to be scared, we have a job to do. Whatever happens up there is in God’s hands. The Reporter hurls another question:

dialogues.speaker: REPORTER
dialogues.text: Well, which one of you wants to go first? Without a beat...every Astronaut raises his hand. And the John Glenn raises both hands. Laughter. Flashbulbs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A madhouse. MORE ENGINEERS, MORE STAFF, more work. Katherine’s at the coffee counter. There are now two coff stations...the smaller coffee pot is labeled: “Colored.” Katherine pours her coffee. Nothing. None made. Imagine that. She makes a pot. Refusing to look around. KATHERINE’S DESK - LATER Katherine's back at her desk, pouring over reports. Stafford drops a stack of data on her desk. Redacted.

dialogues.speaker: STAFFORD
dialogues.text: Mr. Harrison wants you to confirm launch and landing for the Redstone Rocket test.

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE
dialogues.text: I cannot work on what I cannot see, Mr. Stafford. Katherine fans the data sheets. A sea of black ink.

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: It’s illegible.

dialogues.speaker: STAFFORD
dialogues.text: The numbers have been confirmed by two Engineers in this department, and myself. It’s more-or less a dummy check. Stafford walks off. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Script provided for educational purposes. More scripts ca  Hidden Figures - 5/9/2016 - Shooting Draft - 46 .

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Katherine scans the sheets. Holds them up to the light. S can see through the redaction in places. A few terms blee through: “Redstone,” “Atlas.” Curiosity peaks. She looks at the massive chalkboards across the room. A chalked-chart reads: Redstone Rocket Trajectories. She lo back at her worksheets, gathers her work and walks to the boards. Studies the Redstone Rocket Chart.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dorothy’s walking down the hallway with an armload of worksheets. She turns a corner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dorothy continues down a different, white-tiled hallway. It’s crowded with massive crates and MAINTENANCE MEN and TECHS unloading high-tech equipment. The IBM has arrived. And...it doesn’t fit in the door to white room. Lots of head scratching. A PAIR OF CARPENTERS are hacking away, sawing the door header. Harrison stands staring at the debacle. Next to him we me BILL CALHOUN, the young, overly officious IBM Supervisor.

dialogues.speaker: AL HARRISON
dialogues.text: No one thought to measure this thing.

dialogues.speaker: BILL CALHOUN
dialogues.text: I’m afraid not. Should we stop?

dialogues.speaker: AL HARRISON
dialogues.text: No. No, just keep going. Harrison writes a note in his pad. Dorothy walks by. Instinctively...she knows what this is. The next big thing. And the beginning of the end of human Computers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dorothy moves toward a door: “East Computing Group.”

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE THE EAST COMPUTING ROOM
dialogues.text: Dorothy enters the all-white East Computing Room. A sharp contrast to the West Group’s room. Every WHITE FEMALE COMPUTER has a desk, a matching chair, a lamp. It’s homey comfortable, spacious. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Script provided for educational purposes. More scripts ca  Hidden Figures - 5/9/2016 - Shooting Draft - 47 .

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Vivian sees Dorothy, summons her over.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN MITCHELL
dialogues.text: Our runner can pick up your work, Dorothy. You need to be workin’, not walkin’. Dorothy puts worksheets in a box next to Vivian's desk.

dialogues.speaker: DOROTHY
dialogues.text: It’s break time, ma’am. No trouble at all. Vivian points to a massive pile of worksheets within seve boxes.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN MITCHELL
dialogues.text: Since you made the trip...you can take that batch over there.

dialogues.speaker: DOROTHY
dialogues.text: Sure thing, Mrs. Mitchell. Dorothy stands there, a beat too long.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN MITCHELL
dialogues.text: You need somethin’ else?

dialogues.speaker: DOROTHY
dialogues.text: I was wondering if you knew what they’re building in the Tech Wing. Vivian considers whether to answer. Then:

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN MITCHELL
dialogues.text: It’s called an IBM. A mainframe machine. Apparently, it can do our calculations in a fraction-a the time. A knowing moment for both of them.

dialogues.speaker: DOROTHY
dialogues.text: Guess that’s good for NASA. Vivian nods. Dorothy lingers. Vivian points off...

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN MITCHELL
dialogues.text: Hurry on, now. Best if you do it in one trip. Vivian returns to her work. Dorothy heads to the boxes. Script provided for educational purposes. More scripts ca  Hidden Figures - 5/9/2016 - Shooting Draft - 48 .

dialogues.speaker: THE SPACE TASK GROUP OFFICE
dialogues.text: Katherine's still at the chalkboard staring at that Redst Rocket Chart. Cross-checking her worksheets. She picks up a piece of chalk, starts chalking calculatio Analytic Geometry. Then a graph...the Redstone’s trajecto The chalk line stops suddenly. Just short of a line label “Orbit.” She draws an X on the spot, then writes: “Redsto Fail.” Then she draws another trajectory line that pushes past the “Orbit” line...and labels it, “Atlas.” She steps back, looks at her work. Her leg starts tapping She puts the chalk down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Katherine pushes out through the steel doors and runs for West Computing Building.

dialogues.speaker: THE SPACE TASK GROUP OFFICE
dialogues.text: Stafford is standing in front of the blackboard, staring Katherine’s work. He references a worksheet in his hand. He’ll be damned. Sam Turner comes up behind him. Studies the board. Staffo hands him the worksheet. He compares. Hmmm. And then, like moths drawn to light, one ENGINEER after another is pulled to the math. Surrounding Stafford and t blackboard. Chatter builds. Then, a voice from above:

dialogues.speaker: AL HARRISON, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Whose work is that? Harrison stands outside his glass bubble. No one answers. AL HARRISON (CONT’D) I said, whose work is that?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Katherine comes out of the bathroom. Scurries down the ha

dialogues.speaker: PAUL STAFFORD, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: How did you know the Redstone couldn’t support orbital flight? Script provided for educational purposes. More scripts ca  Hidden Figures - 5/9/2016 - Shooting Draft - 49 . INT. AL HARRISON’S OFFICE - DAY - LATER Stafford's pacing in front of a seated Katherine. Sam and Ruth are behind him, along with a UNIFORMED US MILITARY OFFICER.

dialogues.speaker: PAUL STAFFORD
dialogues.text: It’s classified information.

dialogues.speaker: SAM TURNER
dialogues.text: It’s top secret. Across from them is a distressed Katherine.

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE
dialogues.text: It’s not a mystery why the Redstone tests keep failing. It’s fine for sub-orbital flight, but it can’t handle the weight of the capsule and push it into space. The numbers don’t lie. Pan over to: Al Harrison. He's been standing quietly off the side, studying the redacted report.

dialogues.speaker: AL HARRISON
dialogues.text: And you figured that out with this? Half the data is redacted.

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE
dialogues.text: What’s there tells the story if you read between the lines. The distance from launch to orbit is known. The Redstone mass is known. The Mercury Capsule weight is known. And the speeds are there in the data. Impressive.

dialogues.speaker: AL HARRISON
dialogues.text: You did the math.

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE
dialogues.text: Yes, sir. I looked beyond.

dialogues.speaker: AL HARRISON
dialogues.text: Then how did you know about the Atlas rocket? That’s not math. That data’s not here. Like he said, it’s classified. Harrison waves the report at her. Katherine pauses.

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE
dialogues.text: I held it up to the light. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Script provided for educational purposes. More scripts ca  Hidden Figures - 5/9/2016 - Shooting Draft - 50 .

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Really. Harrison holds the report up to the light. Squint at the redaction. Sees: “Atlas.”

dialogues.speaker: AL HARRISON
dialogues.text: Yep. There it is. He shakes his head in disbelief. AL HARRISON (CONT’D) What’s your name?

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE
dialogues.text: Katherine Goble.

dialogues.speaker: AL HARRISON
dialogues.text: Are you a spy, Katherine?

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE
dialogues.text: Am I what?

dialogues.speaker: AL HARRISON
dialogues.text: Are you a Russian spy?

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE
dialogues.text: No sir, I’m not Russian. Harrison looks to Ruth.

dialogues.speaker: RUTH
dialogues.text: She’s not Russian, sir.

dialogues.speaker: AL HARRISON
dialogues.text: All right then, we have nothing to lose here. Let’s get her everything she needs to work on Shepard’s trajectories. Without redaction. Are we clear on that? Nods and agreement. Stafford objects:

dialogues.speaker: PAUL STAFFORD
dialogues.text: Are we sure about this?

dialogues.speaker: AL HARRISON
dialogues.text: What’s the issue, Paul? You heard her...she’s not a spy.

dialogues.speaker: PAUL STAFFORD
dialogues.text: I just don’t think it’s a good idea.

dialogues.speaker: AL HARRISON
dialogues.text: You know what I think is a good idea? Harrison tosses the redacted documents in the trash. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Script provided for educational purposes. More scripts ca  Hidden Figures - 5/9/2016 - Shooting Draft - 51 .

dialogues.speaker: AL HARRISON, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Darker ink. Ruth, think you could pass that along? He walks out. Ruth smiles at Katherine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A BLACK COMPUTER pushes through a door labeled: “Colored Cafeteria.”

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
