dialogues.text: Hardly an adequate dining space. Cold steel tables, wobbl wooden chairs and a small rectangular window, whereby bro bagged lunches are distributed to BLACK EMPLOYEES. Dorothy, Katherine and Mary are at the window, grabbing lunch. Mary’s admiring Katherine’s new lanyard credential

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: You can probably get to the moon and back with these.

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE
dialogues.text: Just not the bathroom.

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: Least they're not blind to what you do.

dialogues.speaker: DOROTHY
dialogues.text: It’s not going to matter soon. This IBM's going to put us all out of work. They walk to a table. Sit. Eat.

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE
dialogues.text: What can we do about it?

dialogues.speaker: DOROTHY
dialogues.text: Only one thing to do: learn all we can. Make ourselves valuable. Somewhere down the line a human being’s going to have to hit the buttons. Through the door, in steps Vivian Mitchell. File folder i hand.

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE
dialogues.text: Oh, mercy.

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: Well, she must be lost. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Script provided for educational purposes. More scripts ca  Hidden Figures - 5/9/2016 - Shooting Draft - 52 .

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Vivian sees the women. B-lines over. She drops the file i front of Mary.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN MITCHELL
dialogues.text: NASA doesn’t commission females for the Engineer Trainin’ Program. Mary ruffles up.

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: That position is open to any qualified applicant.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN MITCHELL
dialogues.text: Right. ‘Cept you don’t have the educational requirements.

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: I have a Bachelors Degree in Mathematics and Physical Sciences. Same degree as most engineers ‘round here. Vivian does not like to be challenged.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN MITCHELL
dialogues.text: We now require advanced extension courses through the University of Virginia. It’s in the Employee Handbook. An addendum. She slides a copy on the table. VIVIAN MITCHELL (CONT’D) ‘Case you haven’t read it. Mary can’t control her frustration.

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: Every time we have a chance to get ahead, ya'll move the finish line. Vivian tightens up.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN MITCHELL
dialogues.text: I just follow the rules around here. And I expect those who work for me to follow ‘em as well. There are no special circumstances for anyone. Ya’ll should be thankful you have jobs at all. Vivian walks off. Steamed. Mary pushes her lunch aside. Script provided for educational purposes. More scripts ca  Hidden Figures - 5/9/2016 - Shooting Draft - 53 . INT. DOROTHY’S HOUSE - ANOTHER DAY The living room. Dorothy and Katherine are playing Bridge Mary’s on fire. Bouncing around the room. Reading the NAS Handbook Addendum.

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: “For those that cannot attend classes at the University of Virginia, Advanced Extension Courses are available at Hampton High School.”

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE
dialogues.text: That’s still a segregated school.

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: Virginia acts like Brown vs. the Board of Ed. never happened. They’1ll never just let a “colored” woman take classes at an all white school! Dorothy is curt.

dialogues.speaker: DOROTHY
dialogues.text: Sounds about right.

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: That’s all you’re gonna say? Dorothy rises.

dialogues.speaker: DOROTHY
dialogues.text: I’m not going to sit here all day and listen to you complain about the way things are. Petition the court. Fight for what you want. She throws her cards down.

dialogues.speaker: DOROTHY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: But quit talking about it. Walks off. Katherine and Mary are silent. Then:

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: I’ve been complaining? Katherine nods ‘yes.’

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE
dialogues.text: For days. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Script provided for educational purposes. More scripts ca  Hidden Figures - 5/9/2016 - Shooting Draft - 54 .

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Dorothy waltzes back in. Holds up a Mason jar of homemade whiskey mash.

dialogues.speaker: DOROTHY
dialogues.text: Not one more peep about work. DOROTHY’S KITCHEN - LATER Music on the radio. The gals are tipsy. Mary’s dancing around the room. Laughing. Dorothy and Katherine are tryi to make a cake and icing. It’s a mess.

dialogues.speaker: DOROTHY
dialogues.text: Don’t give her any more.

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE
dialogues.text: I can’t. She drank it all.

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: I'm fine. I’m as fine as I’ve ever been.

dialogues.speaker: DOROTHY
dialogues.text: You’re as drunk as you’ve ever been. A song comes on the radio, “Twisting The Night Away” by S Cooke.

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: Damn. It’s my wedding song. Katherine, come dance with me.

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE
dialogues.text: What? No.

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: Come on. Dance with me.

dialogues.speaker: DOROTHY
dialogues.text: Go on, Katherine. Go dance. Katherine obliges. Mary instructs. Dorothy joins.

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: We have to teach you how to get a man! Katherine hollers.

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE
dialogues.text: Teach me what! Dorothy and Mary wrap their arms around her. They laugh. And dance. Friends through it all. Script provided for educational purposes. More scripts ca  Hidden Figures - 5/9/2016 - Shooting Draft - 55 .

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A Civil Rights protest in progress. DOZENS OF BLACK MEN A WOMEN holding desegregation signs march outside the Courthouse, chanting. A LINE OF WHITE POLICE OFFICERS blo the sidewalk. Levi Jackson’s smack in the middle of the fray. A POLICE rares up, knocking Levi to the ground. He bounces up, ful of fire. Turning the corner, Dorothy and her two youngest: Leonard and Kenneth (6), walk down the opposite sidewalk.

dialogues.speaker: KENNETH
dialogues.text: What’s happening over there?

dialogues.speaker: DOROTHY
dialogues.text: Don’t pay attention to all that. We're not part of that trouble. Dorothy looks across the way, sees Levi in the thick of i She pulls her boys up the steps of:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They climb the stone stairs of the “Colored Entrance.”

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dorothy’s in the middle of an aisle of reference books. Searching titles. The boys are at her feet, fussing.

dialogues.speaker: DOROTHY
dialogues.text: (taps Leonard on the head) I told you no fussing around. Dorothy hands them a book. DOROTHY (CONT’D) Read together. Be quiet. They do as told. Dorothy keeps searching the racks. She finds what she’s looking for, a book titled: Fortran, The Language of Computers. She pulls it off the shelf. A WHITE LIBRARIAN in the next aisle stares back at her.

dialogues.speaker: WHITE LIBRARIAN
dialogues.text: We don’t want any trouble in here. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Script provided for educational purposes. More scripts ca  Hidden Figures - 5/9/2016 - Shooting Draft - 56 .

dialogues.speaker: DOROTHY
dialogues.text: I’m not here for any trouble.

dialogues.speaker: WHITE LIBRARIAN
dialogues.text: What are you here for?

dialogues.speaker: DOROTHY
dialogues.text: A book.

dialogues.speaker: WHITE LIBRARIAN
dialogues.text: You have books in the colored section.

dialogues.speaker: DOROTHY
dialogues.text: It doesn’t have what I’m looking for.

dialogues.speaker: WHITE LIBRARIAN
dialogues.text: That’s just the way it is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A SECURITY GUARD escorts Dorothy and her boys, not so gen out of the library. The Guard grabs the kids’ shoulders, moving them along.

dialogues.speaker: DOROTHY
dialogues.text: Get your hands off my boys. Don’t touch them. She pulls her boys away from the Guard. Gathers her digni Turns back. Grits a smile. DOROTHY (CONT’D) You have a blessed day.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We push past SEVERAL WHITE PASSENGERS to the back of the bus...where we find Dorothy between her boys.

dialogues.speaker: DOROTHY
dialogues.text: Separate and equal are two different things. Just cause it’s the way, doesn’t make it right. You understand?

dialogues.speaker: THE BOYS
dialogues.text: Yes, Momma.

dialogues.speaker: DOROTHY
dialogues.text: You act right, you are right. That’s for certain. Understand?

dialogues.speaker: THE BOYS
dialogues.text: Yes, Momma. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Script provided for educational purposes. More scripts ca  Hidden Figures - 5/9/2016 - Shooting Draft - 57 .

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: She smiles at her little men. Settles in. Then...pulls th Fortran Computer book out of her purse.

dialogues.speaker: LEONARD
dialogues.text: You took that book, Momma?

dialogues.speaker: DOROTHY
dialogues.text: Son, I pay taxes. And taxes pay for everything in that library. You can’t steal what you already paid for. She opens the book and starts reading to them: DOROTHY (CONT’D) Fortran is a new and exciting language used by programmers to communicate with computers... Titles over: April 12, 1961 INT. DOROTHY’S HOUSE - DAY A birthday party: Leonard Vaughan’s turning 9. The place packed with FAMILY, FRIENDS and CHILDREN. Little Leonard stands, eyes closed (making a wish) in fro of a sprinkled cake. He opens his eyes. Blows. Misses a few. Blows again, way too close.

dialogues.speaker: DOROTHY
dialogues.text: Cake’s already got sprinkles, baby. Doesn’t need a shower. Dorothy gives him a small hug. Everyone LAUGHS and CLAPS. Dorothy starts cutting cake. Katherine and Mary help serv At the entry: Howard opens the door for Colonel Jim Johns Holding a bouquet of flowers. Katherine’s been set up.

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: Look at that. What a surprise.

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE
dialogues.text: I’ll say.

dialogues.speaker: DOROTHY
dialogues.text: Howard must have invited him.

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE
dialogues.text: Mmm. Ammm. Colonel Jim stares through the crowd...over at Katherine. Locks on her. Smiles. Script provided for educational purposes. More scripts ca  Hidden Figures - 5/9/2016 - Shooting Draft - 58 .

dialogues.speaker: THE PARTY
dialogues.text: A swing song plays on the radio. The living-room floor is swaying with Guests swing dancing. Dorothy and Howard. Ma and Levi. Off to the side we find Katherine. Alone. Until Colonel Johnson walks up.

dialogues.speaker: JIM JOHNSON
dialogues.text: I believe I owe you an apology.

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE
dialogues.text: Was that it? Jim smiles.

dialogues.speaker: JIM JOHNSON
dialogues.text: Can I make it while we dance? Katherine looks up at him. He sure is handsome.

dialogues.speaker: DANCING
dialogues.text: Katherine and Jim dance. He’s real good. She’s real stiff

dialogues.speaker: JIM JOHNSON
dialogues.text: I’m afraid I simply misspoke, Mrs. Goble. I’ve been away for a long time. I imagine, I’m just out of practice.

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE
dialogues.text: Mm-hmm.

dialogues.speaker: JIM JOHNSON
dialogues.text: And I was hoping you would allow me to start over?

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE
dialogues.text: Mm-hmm.

dialogues.speaker: JIM JOHNSON
dialogues.text: The thing is...I have an interest in getting to know you better.

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE
dialogues.text: Mm-hmm. He smiles at her.

dialogues.speaker: JIM JOHNSON
dialogues.text: You are one tough customer. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Script provided for educational purposes. More scripts ca  Hidden Figures - 5/9/2016 - Shooting Draft - 59 .

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE
dialogues.text: You haven't said “you're sorry” yet. She’s a whole lot more than he can handle.

dialogues.speaker: JIM JOHNSON
dialogues.text: Right. Of course. I’m sorry, Mrs. Goble.

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE
dialogues.text: For what, Mr. Johnson?

dialogues.speaker: JIM JOHNSON
dialogues.text: Underestimating you. Or any woman like you. Though I can’t imagine there’s many.

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE
dialogues.text: There you go. That’s good practice, right there. They dance on. Staring at each other. The music cuts off abruptly. An ANNOUNCER cuts in:

dialogues.speaker: RADIO ANNOUNCER, (ON RADIO)
dialogues.text: We interrupt Hampton’s Big Band Hour with breaking news. Russian cosmonaut, Yuri Gagarin, has become the first man in space. The mood drops. Dancing stops. You can hear a pin drop.

dialogues.speaker: RADIO ANNOUNCER, (ON RADIO)
dialogues.text: Gagarin completed one full orbit around the planet in one hundred and eight minutes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stale air, tension, dead quiet. A news reel plays footage Yuri Gagarin’s capsule in orbit.

dialogues.speaker: RADIO ANNOUNCER, (ON RADIO)
dialogues.text: This is a crushing blow to America in the race for space. Yuri Gagarin waves to a crowd of RUSSIAN WELL-WISHERS. The news reel stops playing abruptly. Lights rise. Harrison’s standing in the wings, leaning against a wall. Stafford, Sam and Ruth are seated amongst Team Members. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Script provided for educational purposes. More scripts ca  Hidden Figures - 5/9/2016 - Shooting Draft - 60 .

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: The Mercury 7 are in attendance, sitting in back. They’re devastated. No one talks. No one moves. It’s like someone died. Finally, John Glenn speaks up:

dialogues.speaker: JOHN GLENN
dialogues.text: Well. They beat the pants off us. Now let’s go on, learn how to fly to space. He walks out. The other Astronauts follow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harrison steps into the Space Task Group. The entire Team sitting at their desks, standing at stations. Frozen in quiet. Harrison walks to the front of the room. Takes off his glasses.

dialogues.speaker: AL HARRISON
dialogues.text: I want to thank everyone for staying. I know it’s late and after what we just saw, I think everyone’s probably anxious to go home. But before we do, I just have to ask... how can it be that we’re in second place in a two man race? Anybody? Paul? Stafford doesn’t have the answer. Shakes his head. AL HARRISON (CONT’D) Then I think Glenn said it pretty well. They're just outworking us. And the reason I have to think that is because I refuse to believe that the Russians are smarter than us, or because they have more technology. Or that they care more. But I don’t know? Is that possible? Is it possible that it actually means more to them? Harrison walks to the middle of the room. AL HARRISON (CONT’D) We're in the fight of our lives, people. I just saw seven faces that don’t think we can get there. This isn’t some epic joyride that we’re all on together. So, as of right now, going forward, there’s only two things you need to know: one, staying late will be a fact of life. (MORE ) (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Script provided for educational purposes. More scripts ca  Hidden Figures - 5/9/2016 - Shooting Draft - 61 .

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: AL HARRISON (CONT’D) And two: your paychecks will not reflect the extra time it takes to catch up and pass those bastards. For those of you that can’t work that way, I understand and thank you for what you've done. For everyone else, you can call your wives and tell them how it’s gonna be. I’11 start with mine. Harrison walks off. Up to his office.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harrison picks up the phone, dials. Waits. He walks to hi window, looks out. Every single member of the Space Task Group is on the pho Quietly talking to their wives, husbands, children. Paul Stafford. Ruth. Sam Turner. And finally...Katherine Johnson. No one is leaving. MONTAGE — THE PUSH TO SHEPARD’S LAUNCH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Astronaut training. A full scale model of the Mercury 7 capsule is suspended in the air. Spinning in all directio Alan Shepard's inside. Harrison watches from the ground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Katherine’s buried in work. Literally. She’s fighting a cold. Stafford dumps a new load of data on her desk.

dialogues.speaker: STAFFORD
dialogues.text: End of the day. He’s off. Katherine grabs a tissue, blows her nose.

dialogues.speaker: THE TECH HALLWAY
dialogues.text: Dorothy stands at the end of the hallway leading to the I room, clutching her purse. Through the window, she sees Harrison alone, standing in front of the IBM. Cleaning hi glasses. Tortured by this hunk of metal. Finally...he walks out. Clicks off the lights. Heads down the hallway. Script provided for educational purposes. More scripts ca  Hidden Figures - 5/9/2016 - Shooting Draft - 62 . INSIDE THE WHITE ROOM —- CONTINUOUS Dorothy flips the lights back on. The IBM sits ominously staring back at her. She walks to the keypunch, sits down. Opens a draw. Stari back at her: an IBM User Manual. Bingo.

dialogues.speaker: DOROTHY
dialogues.text: Let’s see what you’re made of.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mary walks towards the Hampton County Courthouse. Clutchi case file like a security blanket. She turns down a sidew labeled “Colored Entrance.”

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mary’s at a window, standing in front of a COURT CLERK.

dialogues.speaker: COURT CLERK
dialogues.text: This is your court date. (stamps her case file) Colored seats are at the back of the courtroom. Mary nods. Too happy to be offended.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dorothy’s standing at the blackboard in front of her Computing Group. Teaching Fortran, computer basics from h library book.

dialogues.speaker: DOROTHY
dialogues.text: The IBM 7090 Data Processing System has the ability to solve problems that cannot be solved in a lifetime of manual labor. When working at optimal capacity it is capable of over 24,000 multiplications per second. Bernie cuts in.

dialogues.speaker: BERNIE
dialogues.text: Holy Moses, that’s lightning fast.

dialogues.speaker: ELEANOR
dialogues.text: They'll never get it to work. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Script provided for educational purposes. More scripts ca  Hidden Figures - 5/9/2016 - Shooting Draft - 63 .

dialogues.speaker: DOROTHY
dialogues.text: It‘ll run eventually. We have to know how to program it once it does. Unless you'd rather be out of a job? “Nos” all around. The Girls re-focus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dorothy opens the Power Control on the IBM. She inspects machine’s innards. Cross-referencing with schematics from the IBM Manual. Labeling parts out loud:

dialogues.speaker: DOROTHY
dialogues.text: Control console. Card reader. Card punch. Central Processor. Mother board...always a mother around somewhere.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mary finds Zielinski on a ladder, inspecting the Mercury Capsule.

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: Mr. Z. He looks down at her. She holds up her Court Petition.

dialogues.speaker: MARY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I have a court date.... Zielinski smiles. EXT. KATHERINE’S HOUSE - ANOTHER DAY Katherine, sick as a dog, opens the door to find: Jim Joh holding a paper bag.

dialogues.speaker: JIM JOHNSON
dialogues.text: Heard you were fighting the flu. He holds up the bag. JIM JOHNSON (CONT’D) Thought maybe you could use some soup? Hot meal for the girls. This is a good man. Katherine can’t deny it. Script provided for educational purposes. More scripts ca  Hidden Figures - 5/9/2016 - Shooting Draft - 64 . INT. KATHERINE’S HOUSE - DINING ROOM - LATER Katherine, Jim and the Girls are sitting at the table. Plates of food in front of them. The Girls are sizing up every fiber of this new man in their house. Heads bow for grace. Jim offers Katherine his hand. She takes it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rain pelts the campus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harrison barrels out of his office. Juggling worksheets. Beyond stressed.

dialogues.speaker: AL HARRISON
dialogues.text: Ruth, get the Cape on the line. Shepard's trajectories need to be updated. He looks over to Katherine’s desk. AL HARRISON (CONT’D) Where is she?! Ruth shrugs. Harrison, frustrated, walks off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Katherine’s washing her hands. She grabs a stack of worksheets and rushes out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pouring rain. Katherine runs across campus, back to the E Building.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Katherine’s soaked like a wet rat. She walks back to her desk. Stafford’s staring at her. Ruth’s staring at her. The whole damn place seems to be staring at her.

dialogues.speaker: AL HARRISON, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Where the hell have you been? Everywhere I look you're not where I need you to be. And it's not my imagination. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Script provided for educational purposes. More scripts ca  Hidden Figures - 5/9/2016 - Shooting Draft - 65 .

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Katherine turns, Harrison’s on the floor. Katherine freez AL HARRISON (CONT’D) Where the hell do you go everyday?

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE
dialogues.text: (quietly) The bathroom, sir.

dialogues.speaker: AL HARRISON
dialogues.text: The bathroom! The damn bathroom!

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE
dialogues.text: Yes, sir. The bathroom.

dialogues.speaker: AL HARRISON
dialogues.text: For 40 minutes a day!? What do you do in there!? We are T-minus zero here. I put a lot of faith in you. Katherine can barely speak. She whispers:

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE
dialogues.text: There’s no bathroom for me here.

dialogues.speaker: AL HARRISON
dialogues.text: There’s no bathroom? What do you mean there’s no bathroom for you here? Katherine can’t take it anymore. Her voice rises.

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE
dialogues.text: There’s no bathroom here. There are no COLORED bathrooms in this building or ANY building outside the West Campus. Which is half a mile away! Did you know that? I have to walk to Timbuktu just to relieve myself! And I can’t take one of the handy bikes. Picture that, with my uniform: skirt below the knees and my heels. And don’t get me started about the “simple pearl necklace” I can’t afford. Lord knows you don’t pay “the coloreds enough for that. And I work like a dog day and night, living on coffee from a coffee pot half of you don’t want me to touch! So excuse me if I have to go to the restroom a few times a day! You can hear a pin drop. Katherine takes her purse, personals and walks off. Leaving everyone’s jaws on the ground. Script provided for educational purposes. More scripts ca  Hidden Figures - 5/9/2016 - Shooting Draft - 66 .

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BANG! BANG! BANG! The sound of hammering, tearing. A SECURITY GUARD runs down the hallway and arrives upon a scene: a crowd of TECHS and ENGINEERS block the corridor. pushes through the crowd to the front...where...Ruth hold her hand, stops him. There in front of the group: an inflamed Al Harrison, wielding a crow bar, is bashing the “Colored Restroom” sign on the wall.

dialogues.speaker: AL HARRISON
dialogues.text: Damn thing! On the other side of the corridor...the entire West Compu Group, including Dorothy and Mary watch in wonder. Kather makes her way through, landing between them. Harrison flails away at the sign. Bang! Bang! AL HARRISON (CONT’D) For Christ’s sake! Harrison keeps at it. Rip. Bang. The sign’s holding on, with all it’s might. Imagine that. He takes a final successful WHACK! And the sign crashes to the floor. AL HARRISON (CONT’D) There you have it! No more colored restrooms. No more white restrooms. Just plain old toilets. Harrison looks over. He sees Katherine. AL HARRISON (CONT’D) Go wherever you damn well please. Preferably closer to your desk. Harrison snatches up the sign. AL HARRISON (CONT’D) At NASA we all...pee the same color! He stumbles off. Straight through the Crowd. Shock and pride and justice for all those watching. Katherine nods approval. Titles over: May 5, 1961

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jim and Katherine drive down a picturesque road in a convertible. Script provided for educational purposes. More scripts ca  Hidden Figures - 5/9/2016 - Shooting Draft - 67 .

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The convertible’s parked on the side of the road. Katheri and Jim are sitting on a blanket in front of the car. A r side picnic. Jim pours Katherine a Chianti.

dialogues.speaker: JIM JOHNSON
dialogues.text: I think it’s high time that I kissed you, Mrs. Goble.

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE
dialogues.text: Oh. And why’s that?

dialogues.speaker: JIM JOHNSON
dialogues.text: Figure you're attracted to me the same as I to you.

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE
dialogues.text: Is that right?

dialogues.speaker: JIM JOHNSON
dialogues.text: Yes. Or you would have told me to get going a long time ago. Jim leans in and kisses Katherine. She doesn’t flinch. Ji leans back.

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE
dialogues.text: Haven't kissed a man in a long time. Almost forgot how. Jim leans in again. They kiss again. DOROTHY’S LIVING ROOM — CONTINUOUS Everyone (our Gals, Levi, Howard, Jim, all the Kids) is gathered in front of the TV to watch...

dialogues.speaker: TV REPORTER, (LIVE FEED)
dialogues.text: We're just moments away from Alan Shepard's maiden flight as the first American in space. Food is passed around. People sit on the carpet. It’s the biggest show on Earth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shepard's sitting in the tight ‘can’ he’s named: “Freedom America’s first space capsule. Even through the glass of helmet, you can feel the sweat, the tension. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Script provided for educational purposes. More scripts ca  Hidden Figures - 5/9/2016 - Shooting Draft - 68 .

dialogues.speaker: ALAN SHEPARD
dialogues.text: Any day now, Capcom. Fix your little problem and light this candle!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NASA command is wall to wall with ENGINEERS, TECHS, SUPPO The room laughs at Shepard’s anxiety, a little release of taut energy of the moment. Fellow Mercury 7 Astronaut, Gordon Cooper, is Shepard’s Capcom (Capsule Communicator.)

dialogues.speaker: GORDON COOPER, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Roger that, Freedom 7. Standby. Gordon looks over at Harrison.

dialogues.speaker: AL HARRISON
dialogues.text: Move to final countdown sequence. DOROTHY’S LIVING ROOM Dorothy, Katherine and Mary are locked on the screen. Eve the Children are quiet. Rapt.

dialogues.speaker: TV REPORTER, (LIVE FEED)
dialogues.text: And we’re at T-minus 10, 9...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gordon counts down.

dialogues.speaker: GORDON COOPER
dialogues.text: 8, 7, Gees

dialogues.speaker: THE FREEDOM 7 CAPSULE
dialogues.text: Shepard braces himself. GORDON COOPER (IN ALAN’S EAR) 5, 4, 3... DOROTHY’S LIVING ROOM - CONTINUOUS They countdown along with the Reporter: DOROTHY’S HOUSE FULL 2, 1, 0. Script provided for educational purposes. More scripts ca  Hidden Figures - 5/9/2016 - Shooting Draft - 69 .

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pins and needles. Gordon:

dialogues.speaker: GORDON COOPER, (INTO MICROPHONE)
dialogues.text: You’re go for launch. CAPE CANAVERAL - FLORIDA — CONTINUOUS In the background...the rocket roars up off the launchpad fire spewing from its base.

dialogues.speaker: TV REPORTER, (LIVE FEED)
dialogues.text: And we have liftoff! THE FREEDOM 7 CAPSULE —- CONTINUOUS Alan Shepard is shaking with the blast. Crushed into his seat by the extreme G.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Command Team watches the rocket shoot up into the sky DOROTHY’S LIVING ROOM - CONTINUOUS Katherine pushes the rocket with her words:

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE
dialogues.text: Get up there. Go on.

dialogues.speaker: THE FREEDOM 7 CAPSULE
dialogues.text: Alan Shepard breaks through the atmosphere.

dialogues.speaker: ALAN SHEPARD
dialogues.text: This is okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Command Team finally breathes. Shepard’s voice:

dialogues.speaker: ALAN SHEPARD, (OVER INTERCOM)
dialogues.text: Yaw is OK. Switching to manual roll. The celebration begins. DOROTHY’S LIVING ROOM - CONTINUOUS Cheering and celebrating. The Kids run around. Mary kisse Levi. Howard puts his arm around Dorothy. Jim smiles at Katherine. Congratulations all around. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Script provided for educational purposes. More scripts ca  Hidden Figures - 5/9/2016 - Shooting Draft - 70 .

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: President JFK’s, Rice University, “Space Race” speech, pl under:

dialogues.speaker: JFK, (V.0)
dialogues.text: For the eyes of the world now look into space, to the moon and to the planets beyond and we have vowed... EXT. STREETS OF HAMPTON —- ANOTHER DAY A parade in progress. The Mercury 7 are sitting in the ba of two convertibles. Alan Shepard waves to the crowd, now national hero. WOMEN throw roses. MEN stand and salute. A Marching Band plays, Stars and Stripes Forever.

dialogues.speaker: JFK, (V.0O.)
dialogues.text: ...that we shall not see it governed by a hostile flag of conquest, but by a banner of freedom and peace.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The White House lawn. President JFK presents Alan Shepard with the NASA Distinguished Service Award. The Mercury 7 on stage for the ceremony.

dialogues.speaker: JFK, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: We set sail on this new sea because there is new knowledge to be gained and new rights to be won... Alan Shepard shakes hands with JFK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The entire Space Task Group is gathered in front of Harri and Paul Stafford. JFK's speech plays under:

dialogues.speaker: JFK, (V.0O.)
dialogues.text: ...and they must be won and used for the progress of all people. Stafford hoists the morning paper. JFK on the front page.

dialogues.speaker: PAUL STAFFORD
dialogues.text: I imagine we should all thank President Kennedy for continued job security. Laughs. PAUL STAFFORD (CONT’D) Gus Grissom’s up next. Another suborbital flight with a Redstone. (MORE ) (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Script provided for educational purposes. More scripts ca  Hidden Figures - 5/9/2016 - Shooting Draft - 71 .

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: PAUL STAFFORD (CONT’D) Our last shot before we strap Glenn to the Atlas and pray we can get him back down.

dialogues.speaker: AL HARRISON
dialogues.text: Yes, and I imagine he’d like us to have the math figured out beforehand. Good work, gentlemen. Go have dinner with your kids. Then let’s get back to work. Applause. The Group disperses. Harrison takes the paper from Stafford. Walks off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dorothy’s in a familiar position: deep within the IBM. Sh running a diagnostic. She moves to the control panel. JFK plays under:

dialogues.speaker: JFK, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Yet the vows of this Nation can only be fulfilled if we in this Nation are first, and, therefore, we intend to be first. She types a command. Hits enter. Throws the switch. The IBM whirs to life. Lights. Noise. Drives spinning. She runs to the card feeder. Stuffs a stack of programmin cards in. The machine sucks them right up.

dialogues.speaker: DOROTHY
dialogues.text: That’a girl. A VOICE catches Dorothy off guard:

dialogues.speaker: BILL CALHOUN, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: What the hell are you doing!? Now standing in the doorway: Bill Calhoun and a FEW MAINF TECHS have returned from lunch. BILL CALHOUN (CONT’D) You can’t be in here. Who are you?

dialogues.speaker: DOROTHY
dialogues.text: I'm with the West Computing Group. Dorothy Vaughan, sir. Bill steps up to her. Dorothy presents her NASA ID. A Tec rushes to the IBM. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Script provided for educational purposes. More scripts ca  Hidden Figures - 5/9/2016 - Shooting Draft - 72 .

dialogues.speaker: BILL CALHOUN
dialogues.text: This is a very delicate piece of equipment.

dialogues.speaker: DOROTHY
dialogues.text: I’m sorry, sir. Just trying to be helpful. The Tech calls out:

dialogues.speaker: TECHNICIAN
dialogues.text: Bill, we've got numbers.

dialogues.speaker: BILL CALHOUN
dialogues.text: What kind of numbers? The Tech holds up a worksheet pouring out of the IBM.

dialogues.speaker: TECHNICIAN
dialogues.text: Look. Bill moves to the machine, sees for himself. Turns back t Dorothy. Who just smiles. INT. MARY’S HOUSE - LIVING ROOM - DAY Levi's standing in front of the TV watching the news. As Kids clean the dishes off the table. Walter Cronkite reports on the KKK fire bombing of the Freedom Riders’ bus (May 14, 1961.) Images of the charred bus. Battered RIDERS. The extreme violence.

dialogues.speaker: WALTER CRONKITE
dialogues.text: The mob of Klansman threw fire bombs at the bus, as it stopped in Anniston, AL. Fire and smoke trapped many of the Riders inside the vehicle. Mary comes home from work. No one greets her. Odd. She walks behind Levi. Sees: WALTER CRONKITE (CONT’D) The local police stood by as the choking riders fled the flaming bus. She moves to turn the TV off.

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: The kids don’t need to- Levi stops her. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Script provided for educational purposes. More scripts ca  Hidden Figures - 5/9/2016 - Shooting Draft - 73 .

dialogues.speaker: LEVI JACKSON
dialogues.text: They need to see this. Everyone needs to see this. Mary pauses. The kids join her side. Watching in horror. Finally, Levi walks away. Grabs his coat. LEVI JACKSON (CONT’D) Sit-ins will only get you so far.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FOLKS litter the front of the Courthouse steps.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A packed courtroom. NERVOUS DEFENDANTS, LAWYERS. Way in t back corner, past the sea of White Folks: Mary sits in “Colored Seating,” tapping her foot. Finally, A COURT CLE calls her name:

dialogues.speaker: A COURT CLERK
dialogues.text: Mary Jackson. Petition to attend courses at Hampton High School. Mary hops up. Approaches the rail. A WHITE-HAIRED SOUTHER JUDGE looks up from the case notes. Stops in his tracks w he sees Mary is...black.

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: Good morning, your honor.

dialogues.speaker: THE JUDGE
dialogues.text: Hampton High School is a white school, Mrs. Jackson.

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: Yes, your Honor. I’m aware of that. The Judge flips through the case notes.

dialogues.speaker: THE JUDGE
dialogues.text: Virginia is still a segregated state. Regardless of what the Federal Government says or the Supreme Court says. Our law is the law. He reaches for his rejection stamp. Mary blurts out:

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: Your Honor, if I may, I believe there are special circumstances to be considered. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Script provided for educational purposes. More scripts ca  Hidden Figures - 5/9/2016 - Shooting Draft - 74 .

dialogues.speaker: THE JUDGE
dialogues.text: What would warrant a colored woman attendin’ a white school?

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: May I approach the bench, sir? The Judge considers, waves the BAILIFF to let her through Mary walks through the rail gate, stands in front of him.

dialogues.speaker: MARY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Your Honor, you of all people should understand the importance of being first.

dialogues.speaker: THE JUDGE
dialogues.text: How’s that, Mrs. Jackson?

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: You were the first in your family to serve in the Armed Forces. US Navy. The first to attend University. George Mason. And you are the first State Judge to be re-commissioned by three consecutive Governors.

dialogues.speaker: THE JUDGE
dialogues.text: You’ve done some research.

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: Yes, sir.

dialogues.speaker: THE JUDGE
dialogues.text: What’s the point here?

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: The point is, your Honor... Mary leans in.

dialogues.speaker: MARY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: No Negro woman in the State of Virginia has ever attended an all white school. It’s unheard of.

dialogues.speaker: THE JUDGE
dialogues.text: Yes. It’s unheard of.

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: And before Alan Shepard sat on top of a rocket, no American had ever touched space. (MORE ) (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Script provided for educational purposes. More scripts ca  Hidden Figures - 5/9/2016 - Shooting Draft - 75 .

dialogues.speaker: MARY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: He will forever be remembered as the Navy man from New Hampshire who was the first to touch the stars. The smallest opening in the Judge’s countenance.

dialogues.speaker: MARY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: And I, sir, plan on being an engineer at NASA. But I can’t do that without taking those classes at that all-white high school. And I can’t change the color of my skin. So...I have no choice but to be the first. Which I can’t do without you. Mary looks around the courtroom.

dialogues.speaker: MARY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Your Honor, of all the cases you'll hear today, which one will matter in a hundred years? Which one will make you the “first?” Mary stops talking. The Judge is jarred. He looks around. Considering his legacy. Considering her passion. Then quietly:

dialogues.speaker: THE JUDGE
dialogues.text: Only the night classes. Mary closes her eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mary steps of the courthouse. Containing herself...until can’t hold it in any longer. She screams. She screams wit everything she’s got. Happy and free and full.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Katherine’s at her desk, typing a report. INSERT TYPING: “Gus Grissom, Launch and Landing Projectio by: Paul Stafford.” She hesitates. Then adds: “and Katherine Goble.” She pull the cover page out of the typewriter and sets it on top o the full report. Harrison, Stafford, Sam and a few ENGINEERS come out of Harrison’s bubble. Passing Ruth: (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Script provided for educational purposes. More scripts ca  Hidden Figures - 5/9/2016 - Shooting Draft - 76 .

dialogues.speaker: AL HARRISON
dialogues.text: Ruth, send the tracking station coordinates to the briefing room. Ruth takes a note. Katherine hops up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Katherine catches up to Harrison and Stafford.

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE
dialogues.text: Mr. Stafford, Gus Grissom’s launch and landing coordinates. She hands Stafford the report.

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I'd like to get a jump on John Glenn's trajectory. Stafford slows down. What!?

dialogues.speaker: PAUL STAFFORD
dialogues.text: Do you have any idea what you're asking? Katherine won’t be deterred. She digs in.

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE
dialogues.text: An orbital launch with an Atlas Rocket is going to take time. Harrison slows down, turns back.

dialogues.speaker: AL HARRISON
dialogues.text: Is there a problem?

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE
dialogues.text: Mr. Harrison...I was wondering....

dialogues.speaker: AL HARRISON
dialogues.text: I’ve been wondering my whole life. Spit it out.

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE
dialogues.text: Well, sir, I'd like to get a jump on John Glenn's trajectory.

dialogues.speaker: AL HARRISON
dialogues.text: This isn’t about plugging in numbers, this is about inventing the math. I think we talked about that. It doesn’t exist. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Script provided for educational purposes. More scripts ca  Hidden Figures - 5/9/2016 - Shooting Draft - 77 .

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE
dialogues.text: I can do it, sir.

dialogues.speaker: PAUL STAFFORD
dialogues.text: Do you know how exacting these calculations have to be?

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE
dialogues.text: Yes. It’s like shooting a sawed-off shotgun from a thousand feet and getting that one beebee through a hole so tiny, you can’t even see it. Stafford is not impressed.

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I’m an excellent shot, sir. Harrison studies her. She doesn’t flinch. He takes the report from Stafford. Checks Katherine’s math.

dialogues.speaker: AL HARRISON
dialogues.text: How do Grissom’s numbers look good. Paul?

dialogues.speaker: PAUL STAFFORD
dialogues.text: They appear spot on. Harrison nods his decision.

dialogues.speaker: AL HARRISON
dialogues.text: Give Glenn's orbit a go. But you run it all through Stafford. You understand?

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE
dialogues.text: Yes, sir. Thank you. Harrison hands the report back to Stafford. Walks off. Stafford looks at the report, the cover page. Miffed.

dialogues.speaker: PAUL STAFFORD
dialogues.text: Computers don’t author reports. Stafford rips the cover page off and hands it to Katherin Catches up to Harrison. Titles over: July 21, 1961 - Gus Grissom splashdown

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ocean waves crest over the Liberty Bell 7 capsule, bobbin and down in the middle of the sea. A NEWSCASTER narrates: (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Script provided for educational purposes. More scripts ca  Hidden Figures - 5/9/2016 - Shooting Draft - 78 .

dialogues.speaker: NEWSCASTER, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: We're hearing that the Liberty Bell 7 has experienced some sort of malfunction and the capsule is now taking on water. There is no sign of Gus Grissom. A Navy recovery chopper hovers into frame. DOROTHY’S HOUSE - LIVING ROOM - CONTINUOUS Dorothy, Katherine and Mary are breathless in front of th TV, watching the report.

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE
dialogues.text: The hatch cover must have blown early. Levi, Howard, Jim Johnson and all the Kids gather around. Time stops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harrison, Stafford and the whole Space Task Group are watching radar. Listening to a live report. No one talks, no one moves. Finally...Gus Grissom comes up from the depths, rising hi on a wave.

dialogues.speaker: NEWSCASTER, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Wait. That’s him...in the waves. Gus Grissom is out of the capsule and floating in the middle of the ocean. DOROTHY’S HOUSE - CONTINUOUS A collective breath. The ladies talk to the TV.

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: He blends right in. Grissom fights to stay afloat. His silver suit camouflagi him in the waves. NASA TRACKING CONTROL - HAMPTON, VA -— CONTINUOUS The live feed: the helicopter has attached its winch to Liberty Bell 7 and is pulling it out of the water. Stafford talks to the monitors.

dialogues.speaker: PAUL STAFFORD
dialogues.text: Don’t lose the damn capsule. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Script provided for educational purposes. More scripts ca  Hidden Figures - 5/9/2016 - Shooting Draft - 79 .

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Harrison is on the phone. Incensed.

dialogues.speaker: AL HARRISON
dialogues.text: So, he’s swimming. He’s floating. Goddamnit, I don’t really care. Do we have a visual? Okay. Then where’s the other chopper?! DOROTHY’S HOUSE - CONTINUOUS The live TV broadcast: Splash! The helicopter drops the capsule. Too heavy, too much water. Gasps.

dialogues.speaker: NEWSCASTER, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: The helicopter cable has been cut. The Liberty Bell 7 capsule is lost. Grissom bobs up and down, reaching for help.

dialogues.speaker: DOROTHY
dialogues.text: Get the man. Another chopper drops a cable. Grissom comes up for air. Grasps onto the line. A collective sigh of relief.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The live feed: Grissom is hoisted up into the chopper. Sa The tip of the Liberty Bell 7 capsule sinks below the bla Harrison sits. Devastated.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Senate Hearing in progress. Harrison sits in front of a panel of SENATORS. SENATOR PATRICK grills Al Harrison.

dialogues.speaker: SENATOR PATRICK
dialogues.text: Mr. Harrison, American Taxpayer money sank in the ocean along with your capsule. What makes you think you can bring John Glenn home safely? Harrison adjusts himself. Takes a moment. Then:

dialogues.speaker: AL HARRISON
dialogues.text: Well, let me say first that discovery is never for the sake of discovery but for the sake of human survival, gentlemen, and it will always come with risk. Whoever gets there first, will make the rules. (MORE ) (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Script provided for educational purposes. More scripts ca  Hidden Figures - 5/9/2016 - Shooting Draft - 80 .

dialogues.speaker: AL HARRISON, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: That’s been true of every civilization. And so I think the bigger question for this body to consider is: who do you want calling the shots in space? The Senators are silent. Harrison swings for the fences: AL HARRISON (CONT’D) We have to know what’s out there, Senator. If only to ensure our own survival. We have to touch the stars. And only a man can do that. We’ll get John Glenn home safely because we have to, because he has to tell us what he saw. He stops talking, the Senate Panel weighing his words.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The NASA Campus is still.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul Stafford’s sitting on his desk. The Space Task Group stands all around him. He’s holding a miniature of the Mercury Capsule.

dialogues.speaker: PAUL STAFFORD
dialogues.text: The Redstone Rocket: went straight up. The capsule didn't have enough speed to go into orbit. It came back down. He waves the Capsule up, then back down. PAUL STAFFORD (CONT’D) Essentially it’s a triangle: Earth, suborbit, Earth. The math was known. It took Shepard, it took Grissom. It cannot take Glenn. Stafford demonstrates with the Capsule. Stopping it in mi air. PAUL STAFFORD (CONT’D) The Atlas Rocket can push us into orbit. It goes up. Delivers the capsule into an elliptical orbit. Earth's gravity keeps pulling it, but it’s going so fast that it keeps missing the Earth - that's how it stays in orbit. He arcs the model in an ellipse, around and around. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Script provided for educational purposes. More scripts ca  Hidden Figures - 5/9/2016 - Shooting Draft - 81 .

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: PAUL STAFFORD (CONT’D) Getting it back down...that’s the math we don’t know. Katherine raises her hand. A question. Stafford acquiesce

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE
dialogues.text: So...the capsule will spin around the Earth forever, because there’s nothing to slow it down?

dialogues.speaker: PAUL STAFFORD
dialogues.text: Yes. Slowing it down at precisely the right time, by precisely the right amount is the task. She raises her hand again. Demonstrates with her pencil.

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE
dialogues.text: So...it has to move from an elliptical orbit to a parabolic orbit?

dialogues.speaker: PAUL STAFFORD
dialogues.text: Yes. That’s the Go/ No Go. He pulls the model closer. Tightens the orbit. PAUL STAFFORD (CONT’D) This point is a pin head. We bring him in too soon... Sam interjects:

dialogues.speaker: SAM TURNER
dialogues.text: He burns up on reentry. Stafford completes.

dialogues.speaker: PAUL STAFFORD
dialogues.text: Too late...and he’s pushed out of Earth’s gravity. Katherine raises her hand...doesn’t wait.

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE
dialogues.text: Any changes in mass, weight, speed, time, distance, friction...or a puff of wind...would alter the Go/No Go. And we would have to start calculating all over. Yes? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Script provided for educational purposes. More scripts ca  Hidden Figures - 5/9/2016 - Shooting Draft - 82

dialogues.speaker: PAUL STAFFORD
dialogues.text: Yes. We have to be able to choose this re-entry point. The Go/No Go has to be exact. Stafford motions to Sam, who hands out data briefs. PAUL STAFFORD (CONT’D) These are the latest Redstone numbers and current capsule data. Obviously, we know the launch spot. Engineers scan the data. Harrison and Jim Webb step out of Harrison’s office PAUL STAFFORD (CONT’D) The Pentagon Briefing should illuminate where the Navy needs the recovery zone. We work backwards from there. The rest is on us. Stafford heads off in Harrison and Jim Webb’s direction. Katherine catches up to him.

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE
dialogues.text: Mr. Stafford. Stafford slows.

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Sir. I if can attended these briefings, I would be more useful to the project.

dialogues.speaker: STAFFORD
dialogues.text: Pentagon briefings are closed door.

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE
dialogues.text: Yes. But you know without the latest information, we can’t keep up. I need the changes as they occur. As you said, it’s a pin head.

dialogues.speaker: STAFFORD
dialogues.text: That's the job, Katherine. You asked for the assignment. Calculate with what you have. Or we’ll find someone who can. Stafford walks off. Katherine’s frustrated. Script provided for educational purposes. More scripts ca  Hidden Figures - 5/9/2016 - Shooting Draft - 83 .

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Katherine’s at the chalk board. Working the math. Determined. Exhausted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harrison, Stafford, Sam and Team are walking to the Penta briefing. Katherine catches up to them, report in hand:

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE
dialogues.text: Launch parameters for Friendship 7, sir.

dialogues.speaker: PAUL STAFFORD
dialogues.text: It’s all moot. We’re altering the window on the capsule.

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE
dialogues.text: When did that happen?

dialogues.speaker: PAUL STAFFORD
dialogues.text: 6 minutes ago. The mass is changing. Start over. Katherine's irked, all her hard work...pointless.

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE
dialogues.text: Sir. If I could attend these briefings...I’d be able to stay current-

dialogues.speaker: PAUL STAFFORD
dialogues.text: We've been through this, Katherine. It’s not possible. There’s no protocol for women attending.

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE
dialogues.text: There’s no protocol for a man circling the Earth either, sir. Stafford hands her report back to her.

dialogues.speaker: PAUL STAFFORD
dialogues.text: That’s just the way it is. He walks off. Katherine keeps her head high. Harrison clocks it all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Katherine’s high on the ladder at the chalkboard. One leg dangling as she computes. Chalk dust flies. Harrison’s in his office on the phone, looking out at her Script provided for educational purposes. More scripts ca  Hidden Figures - 5/9/2016 - Shooting Draft - 84 .

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Katherine’s at her desk typing a report. INSERT - The cover page. Typing: "Friendship 7 (John Glenn,) Launch Projections,” By Paul Stafford. Again, she adds: “and Katherine Goble.” She pulls the sheet out and slaps it on top of the rest o her report.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A familiar site: Harrison, Stafford, Sam and Team are wal to the daily briefing. Katherine intercepts:

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE
dialogues.text: (to Stafford) Colonel Glenn’s launch coordinates accounting for the window change, sir. She hands her report to Stafford. Stafford sees her name the cover.

dialogues.speaker: PAUL STAFFORD
dialogues.text: I’ve told you this: Computers don’t author reports. Fix it. He shoves the report back at her. She won’t take it.

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE
dialogues.text: Those are my calculations. My name should be on it. He pulls the cover page off. Katherine reaches for the report now. A tug-of-war.

dialogues.speaker: PAUL STAFFORD
dialogues.text: That is not the way it works. Harrison turns back. He’s watched this long enough.

dialogues.speaker: AL HARRISON
dialogues.text: Paul. What’s happening here? Katherine let’s go of the report. Addresses the bigger issue:

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE
dialogues.text: Mr. Harrison, I'd like to attend today’s briefing. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Script provided for educational purposes. More scripts ca  Hidden Figures - 5/9/2016 - Shooting Draft - 85 .

dialogues.speaker: AL HARRISON
dialogues.text: Why’s that?

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE
dialogues.text: Well, sir, the data changes so fast. The capsule changes. The weight and the landing zones are all changing daily. I do my work, you attend these briefings and I have to start all over. Colonel Glenn launches in a few weeks. And we don’t have the math figured out yet. Harrison weighs it out. He turns to Stafford.

dialogues.speaker: AL HARRISON
dialogues.text: Why can’t she attend?

dialogues.speaker: PAUL STAFFORD
dialogues.text: She doesn’t have clearance, Al. Harrison nods.

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE
dialogues.text: I cannot do my work effectively without having all of the data and all of the information as soon as it’s available. I need to be in that room, hearing what you hear.

dialogues.speaker: PAUL STAFFORD
dialogues.text: Pentagon Briefings are not for civilians. It requires the highest clearance.

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE
dialogues.text: I feel like I’m the best person to present my calculations, Mr. Harrison.

dialogues.speaker: AL HARRISON
dialogues.text: You're not going to let this go. Are you?

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE
dialogues.text: No, sir. Harrison nods again. Takes off his glasses. Stafford shif

dialogues.speaker: PAUL STAFFORD
dialogues.text: And she’s a woman. There’s no protocol for a woman attending.

dialogues.speaker: AL HARRISON
dialogues.text: Okay, I get that part, Paul. But within these walls, who makes the rules? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Script provided for educational purposes. More scripts ca  Hidden Figures - 5/9/2016 - Shooting Draft - 86 .

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE
dialogues.text: You, sir. You’re the boss. Katherine looks at Stafford.

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You just have to act like one. Harrison looks at Katherine. She’s got serious guts.

dialogues.speaker: AL HARRISON
dialogues.text: You keep quiet. Stafford, frustrated, pushes past them and into the room.

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE
dialogues.text: Thank you, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A tornado of high level testosterone: Jim Webb, MILITARY BRASS, John Glenn and the Mercury 7. Harrison, Stafford a Sam enter...Katherine in tow. A record scratch. Until:

dialogues.speaker: AL HARRISON
dialogues.text: This is Katherine Goble with our Trajectory and Launch Window Division. Her work is pertinent to today’s proceedings. No one questions Harrison. She takes a seat at the end of the table. A little mouse in this room. Harrison dives right in, dropping reports on the table. They’re passed o AL HARRISON (CONT’D) We have a confirmed launch window for Friendship 7. Let’s discuss a landing zone.

dialogues.speaker: JIM WEBB
dialogues.text: The Navy needs a singular landing zone. All eyes shift to the Navy Officer.

dialogues.speaker: NAVY OFFICER
dialogues.text: 20 miles square is what we can service for retrieval. Outside of that, we risk the capsule’s recovery.

dialogues.speaker: PAUL STAFFORD
dialogues.text: We'd like 3 possible recovery areas. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Script provided for educational purposes. More scripts ca  Hidden Figures - 5/9/2016 - Shooting Draft - 87 .

dialogues.speaker: NAVY OFFICER
dialogues.text: We can’t cover half the damn ocean. Harrison steps in.

dialogues.speaker: AL HARRISON
dialogues.text: Our capsule’s being altered daily. And we're orbiting the Earth at...what’s the speed now? Harrison looks at Stafford. Who starts frantically flippi through the report. Katherine saves him:

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE
dialogues.text: 17,544 miles per hour. All eyes shift to Katherine. Harrison looks at Katherine.

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: At the time the rocket delivers the capsule into low space orbit. Silence. This woman spoke. This black woman. Then:

dialogues.speaker: JOHN GLENN
dialogues.text: That’s one hell of a speeding ticket. Laughs. John Glenn’s lightened the mood. Webb stares curiously at Katherine.

dialogues.speaker: JIM WEBB
dialogues.text: So we have the capsule’s speed, launch window and for argument’s sake, let’s say the landing zone is The Bahamas...should be enough to figure the Go/No Go.

dialogues.speaker: PAUL STAFFORD
dialogues.text: In theory, sir.

dialogues.speaker: JIM WEBB
dialogues.text: We're flinging a man around the globe at 17,000 miles per hour...we need to be past theory at this point.

dialogues.speaker: AL HARRISON
dialogues.text: We’1l be able to calculate a Go/No Go with that information.

dialogues.speaker: JIM WEBB
dialogues.text: When is that going to happen? Harrison considers his words. Then he looks over at Katherine. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Script provided for educational purposes. More scripts ca  Hidden Figures - 5/9/2016 - Shooting Draft - 88 .

dialogues.speaker: AL HARRISON
dialogues.text: Katherine. Katherine is frozen. He’s serious. Harrison holds out a piece of chalk: AL HARRISON (CONT’D) Have a go at it? Katherine takes the chalk. Rises. Slowly walks to the board. All eyes on her. She stands with her back to the room. A mess they can’t see. She takes a deep breath. And puts her chalk to the board. And...the numbers churn out. She narrates:

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE
dialogues.text: The Go point for re-entry is 2,990 miles from where we want Colonel Glenn to land. She references a coordinate map.

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: If we assume that’s The Bahamas... She writes coordinates for The Bahamas.

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: At 17,544 miles per hour upon reentry... Chalk dust flying.

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: At a descent angle of 46.56 degrees... Chalk scrawling.

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: That puts the landing zone at... Scratch, scratch.

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: 25.0667° North, 77.3333° West. Scribble, scribble. The board is flush with numbers. She circles the final coordinates. And then the spot on the m estimating the landing zone.

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Right here. Give or take 20 square miles. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Script provided for educational purposes. More scripts ca  Hidden Figures - 5/9/2016 - Shooting Draft - 89 .

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Silence as the room studies the board. Her speed, precisi and talent is remarkable. Harrison has witnessed her geni he knows she’s the one. John Glenn breaks the silence. Smiles at Katherine.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN GLENN
dialogues.text: I like her numbers. And that’s it. Katherine is approved. Webb’s not satisfied.

dialogues.speaker: JIM WEBB
dialogues.text: That’s assuming the capsule hits the re- entry point exactly. How do we insure that? Katherine doesn’t have the answer. Harrison steps in.

dialogues.speaker: AL HARRISON
dialogues.text: That’s the math we don’t have yet, gentlemen. We’re working on it. Harrison walks out. Katherine tags after him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harrison stands in front of the massive mainframe. Bill Calhoun and IBM Techs at his side. The IBM hums in the background.

dialogues.speaker: AL HARRISON
dialogues.text: What’s it gonna take to make this thing worth the price tag?

dialogues.speaker: BILL CALHOUN
dialogues.text: We're just getting up to speed here, Mr. Harrison. I need more man power. Programmers. Folks to feed the cards.

dialogues.speaker: AL HARRISON
dialogues.text: Then get them, for crying out loud. You're the IBM man. Pull them out of the sky if you have to, but let’s get ahead of this thing. Or I’m not paying you either. Harrison walks out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dorothy’s reading the assignment sheet. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Script provided for educational purposes. More scripts ca  Hidden Figures - 5/9/2016 - Shooting Draft - 90 .

dialogues.speaker: DOROTHY
dialogues.text: Me?

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN MITCHELL
dialogues.text: Temporarily. Yes. We need the IBM for Glenn's launch. The Lead Engineer says you're good with the cards, programming and such.

dialogues.speaker: DOROTHY
dialogues.text: What about the girls here?

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN MITCHELL
dialogues.text: Human computers can’t calculate an orbital flight in the time we have. They’1l stay put for now.

dialogues.speaker: DOROTHY
dialogues.text: What about after “now?” Vivian shifts. Dorothy knows.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN MITCHELL
dialogues.text: After the Glenn launch, NASA’s dissolvin’ the Computing Groups. Dorothy thinks it over. She hands the assignment back, dr a line:

dialogues.speaker: DOROTHY
dialogues.text: I’m not accepting reassignment. Vivian tightens up. DOROTHY (CONT’D) Unless...I bring my ladies with me.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN MITCHELL
dialogues.text: Excuse me?

dialogues.speaker: DOROTHY
dialogues.text: We're going to need a lot of manpower to program that beast. I can’t do it alone. My gals are ready. They can do the work. Dorothy won’t budge. Vivian won’t budge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dorothy enters the room, holding a NASA Memo.

dialogues.speaker: DOROTHY
dialogues.text: Ladies, we've been reassigned. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Script provided for educational purposes. More scripts ca  Hidden Figures - 5/9/2016 - Shooting Draft - 91 .

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: The Computers chatter. DOROTHY (CONT’D) Leave your calculators. You won’t need them where we’re going. The Computers hop up. Excited.

dialogues.speaker: THE WEST HALLWAY
dialogues.text: Dorothy leads her Group down the hallway.

dialogues.speaker: NASA GROUNDS
dialogues.text: The Women walk in the sunshine en route to East Campus.

dialogues.speaker: THE IBM COMPUTER ROOM HALLWAY
dialogues.text: They arrive in the Tech Hallway. And finally...at the doo to the IBM Room. Dorothy straightens herself...and opens the door. And the all-black West Computing Group steps into the all-white I room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harrison’s standing at the window watching Katherine toil away at the chalkboards. She’s frustrated. She erases a f lines of calculations and starts all over. Stafford drops a report on Harrison’s desk.

dialogues.speaker: PAUL STAFFORD
dialogues.text: Today's heat shield test data, Al. Stafford walks off. Stops when:

dialogues.speaker: AL HARRISON
dialogues.text: Do you know what your job is, Paul? To find the genius among those geniuses. To pull us all up. We all get to the peak together, or we don’t get there at all. Stafford understands.

dialogues.speaker: PAUL STAFFORD
dialogues.text: Yes. Well. Good night, sir. Stafford walks out. Script provided for educational purposes. More scripts ca  Hidden Figures - 5/9/2016 - Shooting Draft - 92 .

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Once again...Katherine is among the last “men” working. She's standing in front of the chalkboard, staring at the numbers. Stuck, for the first time in her life. Stafford stops at his desk. Looks over at Katherine. Star at her work on the board. He walks past her, without a word. EXT. MARY’S HOUSE - DUSK Dusk light bathes Mary's house. INT. MARY’S HOUSE - ANOTHER NIGHT Mary’s sitting on the bed, putting on her stockings. Levi enters, holding a small box.

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: I don’t know when I’1l be home. The class ends at 9. Levi just stands there.

dialogues.speaker: MARY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You have something to say? He hands her the box.

dialogues.speaker: LEVI JACKSON
dialogues.text: Thought you might need these. Mary opens the box. A set of mechanical pencils. LEVI JACKSON (CONT’D) You can refill ‘em with any weight lead you want. Levi sits next to her. Demonstrates how they work. LEVI JACKSON (CONT’D) Just pull the eraser off, like this, drop the new lead down through here. Mary watches him, not the pencil. He takes her hand. LEVI JACKSON (CONT’D) You're going to make a fine engineer.

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: You think so? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Script provided for educational purposes. More scripts ca  Hidden Figures - 5/9/2016 - Shooting Draft - 93 .

dialogues.speaker: LEVI JACKSON
dialogues.text: Yes. Nobody dare stand in the way of Mary Jackson's dreams. Myself included.

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: Amen. Levi kisses her. Mary touches his face.

dialogues.speaker: MARY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Don’t make me mad again.

dialogues.speaker: LEVI JACKSON
dialogues.text: Yes, Ma’‘am. They kiss again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A city bus pulls away, leaving Mary standing in front of Hampton High School. She stares at the building, takes a deep breath and walks toward the entrance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mary walks down the darkened hallway of this typical High School. A lone light shines from the one open door at the end of the hall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mary steps into the classroom. TWO DOZEN WHITE MALE STUDE look up at once. The PROFESSOR turns from the board.

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: Good evening. Is this Quantum Mechanics?

dialogues.speaker: PROFESSOR
dialogues.text: Yes. Mary approaches, hands him a copy of her petition.

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: I’m Mary Jackson. I’m enrolled. The Professor scans the petition. It’s official. He’s genuinely confused.

dialogues.speaker: PROFESSOR
dialogues.text: Well. The curriculum is not designed for teaching...a woman. She’s unstoppable: (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Script provided for educational purposes. More scripts ca  Hidden Figures - 5/9/2016 - Shooting Draft - 94 .

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: Well, I imagine it’s the same as teaching a man. (she smiles at him) I don’t see a colored section. Should I take any seat? He nods. Mary turns to the class. A few seats left. Few o the back row. Few in the middle. One on the front row. Mary steps forward, all eyes on her. She considers her choices. Then...she plops down. First row. Dead center. She pulls out her notebook. Let’s go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Al Harrison sits at his desk, tortured. Studying. He turn to his board, the math. The camera pushes past him to the numbers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Katherine's back at the board in front of a chalked drawi of the capsule’s orbits. Stafford’s sitting on the desk behind her. Sam and other Team Members wrap around.

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE
dialogues.text: The problem is when the capsule moves from an elliptical orbit to a parabolic orbit. There’s no mathematical formula for that. We can calculate launch, landing, but without this conversion...the capsule stays in orbit, we can’t bring it home. Katherine puts her chalk down. Harrison comes up behind them. Studies the board.

dialogues.speaker: AL HARRISON
dialogues.text: Maybe we're thinking about this all wrong.

dialogues.speaker: PAUL STAFFORD
dialogues.text: How’s that?

dialogues.speaker: AL HARRISON
dialogues.text: Maybe it’s not new math at all. Katherine lights up. An idea:

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE
dialogues.text: Maybe it’s old math. Something that looks at the problem numerically. (MORE ) (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Script provided for educational purposes. More scripts ca  Hidden Figures - 5/9/2016 - Shooting Draft - 95 .

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: And not theoretically. Math is always dependable.

dialogues.speaker: AL HARRISON
dialogues.text: For you it is. Harrison walks away. Katherine stands back and looks at t board. The digits come alive. They bounce off the drawing All she sees are the numbers now.

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE
dialogues.text: Euler’s Method.

dialogues.speaker: PAUL STAFFORD
dialogues.text: That’s ancient.

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE
dialogues.text: Yes. But it works. It works numerically. She walks off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Katherine steps into the West Computing Room. She moves t bookshelf and starts digging through math textbooks. She finds a book on Euler’s Method.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The book hits her desk. Pages flip. Euler’s Method. Katherine studies the pages. She rushes to the chalk boar Erases everything. Starts over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Once again, Katherine’s at the chalkboard. The entire surface is full of calculations. Katherine, one hand hold the textbook, the other her chalk, finishes the last bit math on the far right bottom of the board. Almost on her knees. She circles the Go/No Go. She transfers the number to a diagram of the re-entry point. She did it. Katherine puts the chalk down. Turns around. The entire Space Task Group is behind her. Staring up at the board. Paul Stafford walks up to Katherine at the board. Inspect the work. Then:

dialogues.speaker: PAUL STAFFORD
dialogues.text: Let’s type it up. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Script provided for educational purposes. More scripts ca  Hidden Figures - 5/9/2016 - Shooting Draft - 96 .

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Katherine smiles. Heads off to her desk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Katherine finishes typing her report. INSERT: Friendship 7: Launch, Landing and Go/No Go Analys By: Paul Stafford. She pulls the cover page out, sets it on top of the rest her report. And walks the document over to Stafford’s des He nods a thank you. Stafford walks up to Harrison’s office. Hands him the rep and the two men talk. As Katherine puts on her coat, turn off her lamp. And walks out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dorothy’s washing her hands, rinsing her face. It’s been long day. A toilet flushes behind her...and out walks Vivian. A fir for both of them. Sharing a bathroom. Vivian steps up to the sink beside her.

dialogues.speaker: DOROTHY
dialogues.text: Mrs. Mitchell.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN MITCHELL
dialogues.text: Dorothy. Cold silence. Then...

dialogues.speaker: DOROTHY
dialogues.text: You're working late tonight.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN MITCHELL
dialogues.text: Seems to always happen that way.

dialogues.speaker: DOROTHY
dialogues.text: Yes. Seems to. Vivian needs a paper towel, none left on her side. Doroth hands her one. More silence. Then...

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN MITCHELL
dialogues.text: I hear the IBM is at full capacity.

dialogues.speaker: DOROTHY
dialogues.text: Appears so. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Script provided for educational purposes. More scripts ca

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hidden Figures - 5/9/2016 - Shooting Draft - 97

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN MITCHELL
dialogues.text: You certainly have a knack for it.

dialogues.speaker: DOROTHY
dialogues.text: My father taught me a thing or two about mechanics.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN MITCHELL
dialogues.text: You know, I have a few girls in the East Group who have an interest in knowin’ more about it.

dialogues.speaker: DOROTHY
dialogues.text: It is the future.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN MITCHELL
dialogues.text: I may bring ‘em by, if it’s all the same to you.

dialogues.speaker: DOROTHY
dialogues.text: That’s not my decision. That would be the supervisor's.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN MITCHELL
dialogues.text: Yes. That’s true. Dorothy finishes up.

dialogues.speaker: DOROTHY
dialogues.text: Well. Good night, Mrs. Mitchell. Dorothy heads out. She stops,

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN MITCHELL
dialogues.text: You know, Dorothy... turns. VIVIAN MITCHELL (CONT’D) Despite what you may think...I have nothin’ against ya’ll. Dorothy takes this in. Then:

dialogues.speaker: DOROTHY
dialogues.text: I know. I know you probably believe that. Dorothy smiles at her. And then she walks out. Leaving Vivian to absorb the truth of Dorothy’s words. Script provided for educational purposes. More scripts ca  Hidden Figures - 5/9/2016 - Shooting Draft - 98 . EXT. KATHERINE’S HOUSE - NIGHT - LATER Katherine slugs up the walkway to her house. She waves goodbye to Dorothy and Mary pulling away. INT. KATHERINE’S HOUSE - LIVING ROOM — CONTINUOUS Katherine steps in to find, Joylette (Mom,) Joylette (10, Kathy and Constance sitting at the dinner table wearing t best dresses. The table is set, the room bathed in candlelight.

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE
dialogues.text: Please tell me I didn’t miss a birthday. Jim Johnson steps in from the kitchen, wearing an apron, holding a frying pan.

dialogues.speaker: JIM JOHNSON
dialogues.text: Good evening, Mrs. Goble.

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE
dialogues.text: _ (hmmm. ) Jim. The girls help Katherine take off her coat, lead her to t table.

dialogues.speaker: CONSTANCE
dialogues.text: Madame...your seat.

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE
dialogues.text: Is it my birthday? The girls giggle. Katherine sits. Constance pushes her se in. Kathy puts a napkin in her lap. Katherine looks to he Mom.

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Are you going to say anything?

dialogues.speaker: JOYLETTE COLEMAN
dialogues.text: It’s not my place. Jim sits next to Katherine. It’s quiet. Katherine looks them all over. Then:

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE
dialogues.text: Okay, I’m not going to do this all night... (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Script provided for educational purposes. More scripts ca  Hidden Figures - 5/9/2016 - Shooting Draft - 99 .

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: The Girls eye motion to something sitting on the table ri in front of Katherine. She finally looks down...and sees small box damn near under her nose. She knows what it is.

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Oh, mother of mercy. That’s for me. Everyone nods. Jim takes the box. Then...gets down on one knee. Instant tears come to Katherine’s eyes.

dialogues.speaker: KATHY
dialogues.text: Are you sad, Momma? The girls comfort her.

dialogues.speaker: JOYLETTE, (10)
dialogues.text: It’s okay, Momma.

dialogues.speaker: CONSTANCE
dialogues.text: He’s a good man.

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE
dialogues.text: I know. I know. I just. I can’t help it. More tears.

dialogues.speaker: KATHY
dialogues.text: He hasn’t even asked you yet.

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE
dialogues.text: He’s going to. She looks at Jim.

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Is that what you’re going to do?

dialogues.speaker: JIM JOHNSON
dialogues.text: If anyone will let me.

dialogues.speaker: CONSTANCE
dialogues.text: Go on then. She’s already crying. Jim opens the box: a classic, handmade diamond ring.

dialogues.speaker: JIM JOHNSON
dialogues.text: This was my mother’s ring. She and my father were married- Joylette (10) cuts him off. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Script provided for educational purposes. More scripts ca  Hidden Figures - 5/9/2016 - Shooting Draft - 100 .

dialogues.speaker: JOYLETTE, (10)
dialogues.text: For 52 years. Jim looks at Joylette (10). Are you going to let me do th

dialogues.speaker: JIM JOHNSON
dialogues.text: I figure it’s about as lucky a ring as you can get. Jim takes the ring. Takes Katherine’s hand. JIM JOHNSON (CONT’D) The day I met you, I called my mother and asked her if I could have it. I said, “Mom, I met the woman I want to marry.” Katherine cries more. Kathy butts in:

dialogues.speaker: KATHY
dialogues.text: What'd she say?

dialogues.speaker: JIM JOHNSON
dialogues.text: She said, “She must be something, Jimmy. Really something.” Everyone’s enrapt in the story. Constance:

dialogues.speaker: CONSTANCE
dialogues.text: What did you say?

dialogues.speaker: JIM JOHNSON
dialogues.text: I said, “She’s not something. She’s everything.” Jim puts the ring on Katherine’s finger. JIM JOHNSON (CONT’D) I planned on this being more romantic. I’ll make that up to you real soon. But I know marrying you...includes the girls as well. Joylette (Mom) clears her throat.

dialogues.speaker: JOYLETTE COLEMAN
dialogues.text: Amen to that. Katherine takes Jim’s hands.

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE
dialogues.text: I do. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Script provided for educational purposes. More scripts ca  Hidden Figures - 5/9/2016 - Shooting Draft - 101 .

dialogues.speaker: JIM JOHNSON
dialogues.text: I didn’t ask you yet. Katherine kisses Jim. She folds into his arms. The girls wrap their arms around the two of them. A family is born.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A group of Engineers and NASA Techs surround the Mercury Capsule. As we push through the crowd, we find AEROSPACE ARTIST, CECELIA BIBBY, painting “Friendship 7” on the sid the capsule. John Glenn's sitting in the capsule’s hatch, dressed in f gear. As a camera flash bulb pops, capturing the moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Raining. A gray day in every way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harrison is surrounded by piles of work. Katherine steps

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE
dialogues.text: You wanted to see me, sir?

dialogues.speaker: AL HARRISON
dialogues.text: Have a seat. This is serious. She obliges.

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE
dialogues.text: Something wrong, Mr. Harrison?

dialogues.speaker: AL HARRISON
dialogues.text: No. There’s nothing wrong. In fact our IBM is churning out numbers in fractions of the time any human can. Present company included.

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE
dialogues.text: That’s good then.

dialogues.speaker: AL HARRISON
dialogues.text: Maybe. The thing is, the Cape is now insisting on doing all the backups down there. On site. Oh, boy.

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE
dialogues.text: I see. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Script provided for educational purposes. More scripts ca  Hidden Figures - 5/9/2016 - Shooting Draft - 102 .

dialogues.speaker: AL HARRISON
dialogues.text: So, we won’t be running backups here. And truth be told, we can’t keep up with that IBM anyhow. Katherine can barely move. AL HARRISON (CONT’D) Long story short, we no longer need a computer in this department. Progress is a double edged sword. Harrison is struggling. Hard to look her in the eyes. AL HARRISON (CONT’D) Let’s have you report back to the West Group for now. We’1ll see if we can find another assignment.

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE
dialogues.text: Thank you, sir. All the effort. All the work. Gone in a split. Katherine stands.

dialogues.speaker: AL HARRISON
dialogues.text: I’m sorry about this, Katherine. It’s out of my hands, if you can believe it.

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE
dialogues.text: I understand. Katherine walks out. She doesn’t say good-bye. KATHERINE’S DESK - LATER Katherine's gathering her things. Putting her belongings a file box. Ruth walks over, with a small present.

dialogues.speaker: RUTH
dialogues.text: Katherine... She holds out the box.

dialogues.speaker: RUTH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Heard you got engaged.

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE
dialogues.text: Oh. Yes. That’s very thoughtful of you. Katherine takes the box. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
