dialogues.text: Script provided for educational purposes. More scripts ca  Hidden Figures - 5/9/2016 - Shooting Draft - 103 .

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Ruth waits. Until Katherine does the polite thing: she op the present. Looks inside: it’s a necklace of pearls. Rea ones. A consolation prize.

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: They’re lovely.

dialogues.speaker: RUTH
dialogues.text: Mr. Harrison's idea really. Beats the fake ones, that’s for certain. Katherine’s holding back a flood of tears. Ruth rambles:

dialogues.speaker: RUTH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Although I suspect his wife did the picking out. I can’t imagine he has an eye for such things... As Ruth carries on, Katherine takes it all in: the Space Group bustles around her. Never stopping. Never slowing down. Stafford is at the board, conferring with Other Engineers.

dialogues.speaker: RUTH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Now you have a great wedding. You did good work around here. Katherine looks up at Harrison’s bubble. He’s on the phon He makes eye contact with her. Nods a thank you. INT. MCCLEAN BAPTIST CHURCH —- ANOTHER DAY Katherine’s standing in front of a mirror, adjusting the pearl necklace. She studies it in the reflection. We pull out to reveal...she’s dressed in white. Immaculate. Her wedding day. Dorothy and Mary join her in the reflection.

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE
dialogues.text: I don’t think I could feel a thing the first time I did this.

dialogues.speaker: DOROTHY
dialogues.text: You look even more beautiful than you did back then.

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE
dialogues.text: You think so?

dialogues.speaker: DOROTHY
dialogues.text: Just a little older.

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: And a little fuller. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Script provided for educational purposes. More scripts ca  Hidden Figures - 5/9/2016 - Shooting Draft - 104 .

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Katherine laughs.

dialogues.speaker: MARY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: But you look good. They wrap their arms around her. Family forever. Titles over: February 20, 1962

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THOUSANDS OF PEOPLE are camped outside the chain-link fen Signs, banners. American history in the making. John Glenn's spacecraft, the Friendship 7, sits atop the Atlas booster. A NEWS REPORTER talks to camera.

dialogues.speaker: NEWSCASTER
dialogues.text: ..--John Glenn, the first American to orbit the Earth. There are thousands of people here today... People scream. Wave at the camera.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We pull out of the newscast on a TV to find: Dorothy, Katherine, Mary and the West Computing Gals huddled watch INT. NASA —- TRACKING CONTROL ROOM — CONTINUOUS Langley Command Central. ENGINEERS man every station. Stafford is chewing a pencil. Zielinski’s pacing. Sam brings Harrison the latest launch calculations. He sc them. Something’s off.

dialogues.speaker: AL HARRISON
dialogues.text: These landing coordinates don’t match yesterday's.

dialogues.speaker: PAUL STAFFORD
dialogues.text: The IBM just ran them.

dialogues.speaker: AL HARRISON
dialogues.text: Then the IBM was wrong yesterday. Or it’s wrong today.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John Glenn pours himself a coffee. Surrounded by NASA PERSONNEL. Scott Carpenter enters, with a data sheet. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Script provided for educational purposes. More scripts ca  Hidden Figures - 5/9/2016 - Shooting Draft - 105 .

dialogues.speaker: SCOTT CARPENTER
dialogues.text: The landing coordinates are off. He hands John Glenn the data. He scans it.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN GLENN
dialogues.text: What’s Langley saying?

dialogues.speaker: SCOTT CARPENTER
dialogues.text: They're on the line. John Glenn walks over to the phone. Picks up.

dialogues.speaker: NASA
dialogues.text: Harrison’s on the phone with John Glenn.

dialogues.speaker: AL HARRISON, (ON PHONE)
dialogues.text: The IBM has been spot on up to this point, John, but we’1ll run it again, see what it comes up with.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN GLENN, (ON PHONE)
dialogues.text: To be honest with you, Al...when I fly, I fly the machine and now I feel like the machines are flying me. John Glenn laughs. Always a cool customer.

dialogues.speaker: AL HARRISON
dialogues.text: We’re on the same page. We’re staying on the ground until this works out our way. Stay tuned.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN GLENN
dialogues.text: Let’s get the girl to check the numbers.

dialogues.speaker: AL HARRISON
dialogues.text: The girl?

dialogues.speaker: JOHN GLENN
dialogues.text: Yes, sir. The smart one. If she says they’re good, I’m ready to go.

dialogues.speaker: AL HARRISON
dialogues.text: All right. We’1ll get into it. Harrison hangs up, calls out to Sam: (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Script provided for educational purposes. More scripts ca  Hidden Figures - 5/9/2016 - Shooting Draft - 106 .

dialogues.speaker: HARRISON
dialogues.text: Sam...go find Katherine. She needs to verify Glenn’s Go/No Go or we're staying on the ground.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: Yes, sir. The Assistant Engineer rushes off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam runs off toward the West Campus, lugging worksheets.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam barrels into the room. All heads turn his way.

dialogues.speaker: SAM TURNER
dialogues.text: I’m looking for Katherine Goble?! Katherine holds up her hand. Like a student.

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE
dialogues.text: It’s Katherine Johnson now.

dialogues.speaker: SAM TURNER
dialogues.text: They need you to verify these. He holds out the data.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The stack of worksheets slam on a steel table. Followed b pads of paper, an old calculator, slide ruler, several pencils and erasers. Katherine sits. Starts organizing her work, her area, her thoughts. The entire West Group hovers around her.

dialogues.speaker: DOROTHY
dialogues.text: Alright, give her space. Let her work. The Computers back off. Katherine takes a deep breath and digs in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John Glenn, fully dressed in his space suit, steps out of hangar, carrying his own portable air conditioner. Scott Carpenter’s at his side: (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Script provided for educational purposes. More scripts ca  Hidden Figures - 5/9/2016 - Shooting Draft - 107 .

dialogues.speaker: JOHN GLENN
dialogues.text: Anything from Langley?

dialogues.speaker: SCOTT CARPENTER
dialogues.text: Not yet. They step into a waiting transport van.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dorothy, Mary and the Computers are back in front of the Dorothy has one eye on Katherine.

dialogues.speaker: NEWSCASTER, (ON TV)
dialogues.text: T-minus 60 minutes. All the final tests and checks are being conducted. John Glenn is ready to board the Friendship 7. Katherine scribbles furiously. She writes Azimuth Angle a a degree with multiple decimals. Then: ‘RE-ENTRY Go/No Go and numbers through the sixth decimal place.

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE
dialogues.text: Recovery position: Longitude 21.347821. The Ladies abandon the TV. Move to Katherine, in awe of h pencil scrawling the most complex calculations.

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Latitude -69.643667. She writes the final number, a hard point on the decimal. Drops her pencil. Takes a breathe.

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: What the devil are you doing? Taking a break? Katherine jumps up, gathers her work, runs like the wind.

dialogues.speaker: WEST HALLWAY
dialogues.text: Katherine and Sam fly down the hall.

dialogues.speaker: PAD 14
dialogues.text: John Glenn and the NASA Entourage step onto an elevator. John Glenn asks Scott Carpenter for the time. He shows hi his watch. Script provided for educational purposes. More scripts ca  Hidden Figures - 5/9/2016 - Shooting Draft - 108 .

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Katherine and Sam run. Katherine turns sharply, she knows the inside track. Sam catches up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Katherine and Sam race toward the Tracking Control Room. NASA EMPLOYEES jump out of the way. Sam wraps on the door Bang! Bang! Bang!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another Assistant Engineer opens the door. Katherine hand him the work:

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE
dialogues.text: Here you go. Sam steps inside. And before Katherine can get a word in, the door closes in her face. She’s locked out. She stands there, decompressing. All that work. All that energy. Never an ounce of satisfaction. Eventually...she walks away. Down the hallway. Crash! The door springs open. Harrison steps out into the hallway:

dialogues.speaker: AL HARRISON
dialogues.text: Katherine. She turns at the familiar voice. He holds up a lanyard: a special clearance badge. TRACKING CONTROL ROOM —- CONTINUOUS Harrison escorts Katherine into the room: the Engineers a control stations, the massive screens, the live feeds, tracking stations, tech details, etc. The energy. Katherine’s in awe. This is the culmination of her work.

dialogues.speaker: SAM TURNER
dialogues.text: (calls out to Harrison) Sir, we've got Pad 14 at the Cape on the line. Harrison hits a button on the intercom. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Script provided for educational purposes. More scripts ca  Hidden Figures - 5/9/2016 - Shooting Draft - 109 .

dialogues.speaker: AL HARRISON, (ON MIC)
dialogues.text: This is Langley. We have the coordinates confirmed.

dialogues.speaker: PAD 14
dialogues.text: Scott Carpenter’s on the Pad phone.

dialogues.speaker: SCOTT CARPENTER, (ON PHONE)
dialogues.text: (to John Glenn, at the prep pad) Langley’s on the phone.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN GLENN
dialogues.text: Right on time. John Glenn stalks over.

dialogues.speaker: SCOTT CARPENTER, (ON PHONE)
dialogues.text: What do you say, Langley? Harrison pipes up:

dialogues.speaker: AL HARRISON, (ON MIC)
dialogues.text: We can confirm the Go/No Go point for re-entry is 16.11984, -165.2356. The launch window is a go. The landing coordinates match. John Glenn answers himself.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN GLENN, (ON PHONE)
dialogues.text: Good to hear that, Al. Hard to trust something you can’t look in the eyes. The whole Team lights up at the sound of John Glenn’s voi

dialogues.speaker: AL HARRISON, (ON MIC)
dialogues.text: That's right, Colonel. Katherine did manage to calculate a few decimal points further than that hunk of metal.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN GLENN, (ON PHONE)
dialogues.text: I‘ll take every digit ya got. Be sure to thank her for me.

dialogues.speaker: AL HARRISON, (ON MIC)
dialogues.text: Copy that. Good luck, Friendship 7. We'll see you in the Bahamas.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN GLENN, (ON PHONE)
dialogues.text: God speed, Langley. Script provided for educational purposes. More scripts ca  Hidden Figures - 5/9/2016 - Shooting Draft - 110 .

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dorothy, Mary and the West Group are glued to the TV.

dialogues.speaker: NEWSCASTER, (ON TV)
dialogues.text: T-minus 10 seconds. 9. 8.

dialogues.speaker: THE FRIENDSHIP 7 CAPSULE
dialogues.text: John Glenn is laser focused. Still. Calm.

dialogues.speaker: SHOTS OF THE ENTIRE NATION COUNTING DOWN
dialogues.text: -- The throngs of people at Cocoa Beach. -- People in front of a TV Store in Times Square. TRACKING CONTROL ROOM —- CONTINUOUS Harrison turns away from the screens. Doesn’t care to wat Katherine’s riveted.

dialogues.speaker: MISSION CONTROL COMMANDER, (ON INTERCOM)
dialogues.text: 4. 3. 2. 1. Ignition. Go for liftoff.

dialogues.speaker: CAPE CANAVERAL
dialogues.text: The rocket blasts off the pad. Heads toward the heavens. People stare in awe.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN GLENN, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: We're programming into a roll.

dialogues.speaker: MISSION CONTROL COMMANDER, (V.0O)
dialogues.text: Roger that.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN GLENN, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: It’s getting bumpy along here.

dialogues.speaker: MISSION CONTROL COMMANDER, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Roger that. You are in Max Q.

dialogues.speaker: THE WEST COMPUTERS
dialogues.text: No one moves:

dialogues.speaker: JOHN GLENN, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Roger that, smoothing out real fine. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Script provided for educational purposes. More scripts ca  Hidden Figures - 5/9/2016 - Shooting Draft - 111 .

dialogues.speaker: MISSION CONTROL COMMANDER, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Twenty seconds to SECO--

dialogues.speaker: JOHN GLENN, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Zero G. Feeling fine. I feel fine. Harrison rubs his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: MISSION CONTROL COMMANDER, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Go for SECO. The rocket becomes an indiscernible blaze high in the air the screen.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN GLENN, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Roger that. And then...it’s gone.

dialogues.speaker: CAPE CANAVERAL
dialogues.text: The crowd is silent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harrison cracks his neck. The silence is torture. Then:

dialogues.speaker: JOHN GLENN, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Oh, that view is tremendous. And, John Glenn’s in space. A collective sigh of relief.

dialogues.speaker: MISSION CONTROL COMMANDER, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Roger, that, Friendship 7. You are go for orbit. The journey has just begun. Harrison finally turns to the screens.

dialogues.speaker: AL HARRISON
dialogues.text: 10.5 hours to go. If we make 7 round trips. He sits down. A rare event. AL HARRISON (CONT’D) I need a coffee. Assistants scramble. Script provided for educational purposes. More scripts ca  Hidden Figures - 5/9/2016 - Shooting Draft - 112 .

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Computers are packing up for the day. Heading home. Dorothy’s the last. She shuts off the TV. Vivian Mitchell enters. Envelope in hand, she holds it ou

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN MITCHELL
dialogues.text: New assignment came down the pike. Dorothy takes the envelope. Doesn't want to open it. VIVIAN MITCHELL (CONT’D) Always changin’ ‘round here. Hard to keep up. Dorothy opens the envelope. Reads. Poker-faced. She looks up to Vivian. VIVIAN MITCHELL (CONT’D) Seems like they’re gonna need a permanent team to feed that IBM.

dialogues.speaker: DOROTHY
dialogues.text: How big of a team?

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN MITCHELL
dialogues.text: 30 to start. They stare at each other for the longest time. An understanding between them. Some growth. But mostly...respect.

dialogues.speaker: DOROTHY
dialogues.text: Thank you for the information, Mrs. Mitchell.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN MITCHELL
dialogues.text: You're quite welcome...Mrs. Vaughan. Mrs. Vaughan? Yes. She called her Mrs. Vaughan. Vivian walks out. Dorothy opens the letter and re-reads: INSERT - Dorothy Vaughan, Transfer Assignment to: IBM Computing Lab. Position: Supervisor. She walks to the door. Turns back. Takes one last look at her old digs: the adding machines, the mismatched desks.. finally the “Colored Computers” sign. And...she shuts off the lights. Script provided for educational purposes. More scripts ca  Hidden Figures - 5/9/2016 - Shooting Draft - 113 . TRACKING CONTROL ROOM —- CONTINUOUS Harrison's drinking coffee. Katherine’s sitting in a chai Stafford is talking to TECHS. Zielinski’s eating a sandwi Suddenly, a warning light blinks red.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN GLENN, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Capcom 7, I have a warning light.

dialogues.speaker: THE FRIENDSHIP 7 CAPSULE
dialogues.text: John Glenn inspects his console. MISSION CONTROL COMMANDER (IN JOHN’S EAR) Standby, Friendship 7. TRACKING CONTROL ROOM —- CONTINUOUS Zielinski turns to Harrison.

dialogues.speaker: ZIELINSKI
dialogues.text: It’s the heat shield lock, Al.

dialogues.speaker: AL HARRISON
dialogues.text: What are we looking at, Stafford?

dialogues.speaker: STAFFORD
dialogues.text: The heat shield may have come loose.

dialogues.speaker: MISSION CONTROL COMMANDER, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: 7, will you confirm the landing bag is in the OFF position?

dialogues.speaker: THE FRIENDSHIP 7 CAPSULE
dialogues.text: John Glenn checks:

dialogues.speaker: JOHN GLENN
dialogues.text: Affirmative, Capcom. MISSION CONTROL COMMANDER (IN JOHN’S EAR) Have you heard any banging noises or anything of this type at higher rates?

dialogues.speaker: JOHN GLENN
dialogues.text: That’s a negative. TRACKING CONTROL ROOM —- CONTINUOUS Stafford is a mess: (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Script provided for educational purposes. More scripts ca  Hidden Figures - 5/9/2016 - Shooting Draft - 114 .

dialogues.speaker: STAFFORD
dialogues.text: We need to get him down, now. We could burn up on re-entry. Harrison considers. Then:

dialogues.speaker: AL HARRISON
dialogues.text: Get Hawaii Capcom. EXT. GRAMMAR SCHOOL —- CONTINUOUS Mary’s outside her kids’ school, scanning the dozens of children for her little ones. Levi, Jr. and Carolyn Marie break through the crowd. Hug their Momma.

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: Gotta hurry, bunny rabbits. There’s a man in space. We don’t want to miss it. Mary stops in her tracks. Across the street: a CROWD is gathering in front of an appliance store window full of T Anxiety. Worry on faces. A MAN yells:

dialogues.speaker: MAN
dialogues.text: Something’s wrong with Glenn. Mary pulls her kids that way.

dialogues.speaker: APPLIANCE STORE WINDOW
dialogues.text: The TV Newscaster:

dialogues.speaker: NEWSCASTER
dialogues.text: We've just learned, the Friendship 7 is in danger of losing its heat shield. Mary and her kids, step up to the window. This is bad.

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: (talks to the TV) Tell them not to jettison the retro- package. INT. DOROTHY’S CAR - CONTINUOUS Dorothy’s driving home. Listening to the radio newscast o the mission. She turns the volume up. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Script provided for educational purposes. More scripts ca  Hidden Figures - 5/9/2016 - Shooting Draft - 115 .

dialogues.speaker: NEWSCASTER, (ON RADIO)
dialogues.text: NASA is confirming this is some sort of malfunction with the capsule’s heat shield and it may not stay in place. This doesn't look good for John Glenn, America’s hero...is in danger. TRACKING CONTROL ROOM —- CONTINUOUS Panic. Stafford’s on the phone. Harrison’s talking at him

dialogues.speaker: AL HARRISON
dialogues.text: Tell them not to jettison the retro- package. If the heat shield is loose, the retro-package straps might hold it in place.

dialogues.speaker: PAUL STAFFORD
dialogues.text: Hawaii. This is Langely... He waits. PAUL STAFFORD (CONT’D) (quietly) Oh, God. It’s got to work.

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE
dialogues.text: It will work. The retro pack will hold it until the re-entry pressure secures the shield. Katherine gives Stafford a supportive nod.

dialogues.speaker: APPLIANCE STORE WINDOW
dialogues.text: Mary talks to the TV.

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: He has to override the 05g. TRACKING CONTROL ROOM —- CONTINUOUS The air doesn't move. Zielinski’s also on the phone. He hollers out:

dialogues.speaker: ZIELINSKI
dialogues.text: He has to override the 05g.

dialogues.speaker: MISSION CONTROL COMMANDER, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Friendship 7, we're recommending that the retro-package NOT, I say again, NOT be jettisoned. This means that you will have to override the 05g switch. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Script provided for educational purposes. More scripts ca  Hidden Figures - 5/9/2016 - Shooting Draft - 116 .

dialogues.speaker: JOHN GLENN, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Ah, Roger, that command. I’11 have to make a manual 05g entry, and bring the scope in.

dialogues.speaker: AL HARRISON
dialogues.text: He knows. INT. DOROTHY’S CAR - CONTINUOUS Driving. Listening to the radio.

dialogues.speaker: NEWSCASTER, (ON RADIO)
dialogues.text: Without a heat shield, there’s no way for John Glenn to get back through the Earth’s atmosphere. Dorothy sees cars in the middle of the road, pulled over the shoulder, traffic stopped. Time stopped. PEOPLE are looking up to the sky. Some are on their knees: praying. Some crying. TRACKING CONTROL ROOM —- CONTINUOUS All eyes on the screens:

dialogues.speaker: MISSION CONTROL COMMANDER, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: You're going to use fly-by-wire for reentry. You’ll need to maintain a zero angle. Over.

dialogues.speaker: THE FRIENDSHIP 7 CAPSULE
dialogues.text: John Glenn is oddly calm.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN GLENN
dialogues.text: Ah, Roger. I'm on fly-by-wire, back-it up with manual. Over. MISSION CONTROL COMMANDER (IN JOHN’S EAR) Roger. The weather in the recovery area: 3-foot waves, 10 miles visibility.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN GLENN
dialogues.text: Roger. You're ground-- (static) --you are going out-- TRACKING CONTROL ROOM —- CONTINUOUS Harrison rubs his whole head. Stafford is damn near shaki (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Script provided for educational purposes. More scripts ca  Hidden Figures - 5/9/2016 - Shooting Draft - 117 .

dialogues.speaker: STAFFORD
dialogues.text: He’s crossing the communication black-out zone.

dialogues.speaker: AL HARRISON
dialogues.text: Keep talking to him.

dialogues.speaker: MISSION CONTROL COMMANDER, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Seven, do you copy?

dialogues.speaker: JOHN GLENN, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: I think the package just let go. Do you copy? There’s a real fireball outside and-- John Glenn cuts off abruptly. The room is flattened.

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE
dialogues.text: Please, God.

dialogues.speaker: MISSION CONTROL COMMANDER, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Friendship 7. Do you copy? Over. Nothing. Stafford bends over, head in his hands. Harrison walks over to the microphone. lLeans down to it. Listens.

dialogues.speaker: MISSION CONTROL COMMANDER, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Friendship 7, do you copy? Over. Nothing.

dialogues.speaker: CAPE CANAVERAL
dialogues.text: Hundreds of people are silent outside the gates. TRACKING CONTROL ROOM —- CONTINUOUS Zielinski is motionless.

dialogues.speaker: MISSION CONTROL COMMANDER, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Friendship 7, do you copy? Over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dorothy’s out of her car. Amongst the crowd. White, black united. She gets down on her knees. The Radio broadcast echoes from the dozens of cars. Script provided for educational purposes. More scripts ca  Hidden Figures - 5/9/2016 - Shooting Draft - 118 .

dialogues.speaker: APPLIANCE STORE WINDOW
dialogues.text: The window reflects Mary and her kids...and the other fro faces. TRACKING CONTROL ROOM —- CONTINUOUS Nothing moves. No one breathes. The air is still.

dialogues.speaker: MISSION CONTROL COMMANDER, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Friendship 7, do you copy? Over. Still nothing. Harrison turns away from the screen. And then miraculously:

dialogues.speaker: JOHN GLENN, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Loud and clear, Capcom. Cheers of relief.

dialogues.speaker: MISSION CONTROL COMMANDER, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Roger that. How are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: JOHN GLENN, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: My condition is good. But that was a real fireball, boy. Stafford sinks into his chair, overwhelmed.

dialogues.speaker: MISSION CONTROL COMMANDER
dialogues.text: Roger that. Let’s get you all the way home.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN GLENN, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Roger. Here’s hoping these landing coords still hold. Harrison looks over at Katherine, she’s on her tip toes. Leaning, as if wishing the capsule on trajectory.

dialogues.speaker: MISSION CONTROL COMMANDER
dialogues.text: Approaching 16.119.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN GLENN, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Roger.

dialogues.speaker: MISSION CONTROL COMMANDER
dialogues.text: Approaching -165.23. In 3, 2, 1.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN GLENN, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Engaging chutes. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Script provided for educational purposes. More scripts ca  Hidden Figures - 5/9/2016 - Shooting Draft - 119 .

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: And then, on the screen, Friendship 7 comes into view. Th parachute deploying.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN GLENN, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: How do I look, Capcom?

dialogues.speaker: MISSION CONTROL COMMANDER
dialogues.text: Standby 7. An Engineer hands the Mission Commander a calculation. He cross checks the coordinates. Then: MISSION CONTROL COMMANDER (CONT’D) Your Go/No Go is good. Landing coordinates are spot on, 7. Katherine breaths. Her numbers stood the test.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN GLENN
dialogues.text: Roger that, Capcom. Always wanted to swim in the Bahamas. Over. Katherine smiles over at a relieved Harrison.

dialogues.speaker: CAPE CANAVERAL
dialogues.text: The Crowd erupts. Men shake the fence.

dialogues.speaker: MISSION CONTROL COMMANDER, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Friendship 7, we have you in our sights. The Navy is en route to recover. EXT. SIDE OF THE ROAD — CONTINUOUS Women are crying. Men hold kids. Dorothy smiles up at the sky.

dialogues.speaker: RADIO ANNOUNCER, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: John Glenn has splashed-down and is being recovered.

dialogues.speaker: APPLIANCE STORE WINDOW
dialogues.text: Mary screams out in joy.

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: Thank you, GOD! The Crowd echoes the sentiment. Script provided for educational purposes. More scripts ca  Hidden Figures - 5/9/2016 - Shooting Draft - 120 .

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mary’s in cap and gown, post graduation. She runs into th waiting arms of: Katherine and Dorothy. Happiest day of h life. The women celebrate, laugh. Karl Zielinski tips his hat to Mary. Smiles at her. Mary takes off her cap and throws it high into the sky. Titles over: “Mary Jackson went on to obtain her Master's degree in engineering from the University of Virginia. She became the first female engineer...of any color at NA INT. DOROTHY’S CAR - LATER Dorothy’s driving home. Titles over: “Dorothy Vaughan became the Head of Langley’ centralized Electronic Computing Group, as NASA’s first b Supervisor. In 1964 she joined the Scout Team, working to send unmanned explorers to Mars.”

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dorothy’s standing in front of the mainframe, her sleeves rolled up. Vivian Mitchell walks in with a GROUP OF TRANS EMPLOYEES. Black and white. All women.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN MITCHELL
dialogues.text: Girls. This is Mrs. Vaughan. Your supervisor. She’1ll show you how things work. Dorothy looks over her new employees.

dialogues.speaker: DOROTHY
dialogues.text: Ladies...better roll those sleeves up. This here is manual labor. TRACKING CONTROL ROOM —- CONTINUOUS A celebration. Engineers hug each other. Cigars are lit. Somewhere champagne pops. Harrison walks over to Katherin

dialogues.speaker: AL HARRISON
dialogues.text: Nice work, Katherine. He offers her his hand. They shake.

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE
dialogues.text: You too, Mr. Harrison. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Script provided for educational purposes. More scripts ca  Hidden Figures - 5/9/2016 - Shooting Draft - 121 .

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: He smiles, for the first time. Ever. Underneath it all...Harrison’s a kid:

dialogues.speaker: AL HARRISON
dialogues.text: You think we can get to the moon? Katherine nods, with all the certainty in the world:

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE
dialogues.text: We're already there, sir. Titles over: “In 1962 Katherine Johnson became a permanen member of the Space Task Group. She went on to perform th calculations for Armstrong, Aldrin and Collins's, Apollo flight to the moon. A year later, her backup calculations proved critical to the successful effort to rescue the astronauts in the damaged Apollo 13 spacecraft. In 2015, Katherine was awarded the Presidential Medal of Freedom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Space Task Group is all but empty. Katherine finishes typing a report: “Notes on Space Technology” by, Paul Stafford...and...Katherine Johnson. She pulls the cover p out of the typewriter, sets it on top of the rest of the manuscript. Stafford walks over, puts a cup of coffee on Katherine's desk. Picks up the report. He walks off. Katherine sips her coffee. Another day at work. FADE OUT. The end. Script provided for educational purposes. More scripts ca
